title: Fact #1
text: Wesley Snipes, as Boar Man in the 1996 remake of The Island of Dr. Moreau, had his contract terminated following a series of aggressive, unscripted provocations to Marlon Brando’s character during the course of which Snipes allegedly gored the barely ambulant Brando from behind repeatedly with tusk implants that didn’t appear anywhere in the script.

title: Fact #2
text: Just before shooting Blade, Wesley Snipes auditioned for a recurring role in a series of Progressive auto insurance ads in which Snipes’ signature Cadillac Escalade was firebombed by a wisecracking masked figure many believe to have been been an out-of-work Emilio Estevez. The starring role eventually went to Estevez, fueling rumors that he was indeed the mystery arsonist. Though he could never prove it, Snipes never forgave Estevez, who was originally tapped to play Nick Peretti in New Jack City II: The Return of Pookie, a role which ultimately went to Alvin Lee Ritter.

title: Fact #3
text: On the set of New Jack City, Wesley Snipes once defeated co-star Judd Nelson at chess. Snipes, a grand master in Puerto Rico, played blindfolded.

title: Fact #4
text: Though he is frequently mistaken for a dwarf due to his dis­proportionately large head, Wesley Snipes was in fact a pituitary midget.1 Snipes addresses the issue in his memoir, Snipes.
notes: <sup>1</sup>Snipes stood 3’6” until he was twenty-two, when he sprouted to 3’8” following a number of aggressive Italian growth therapies.

title: Fact #5
text: On an unaired episode of The Oprah Winfrey Show, Wesley Snipes admitted to daring Richard Gere to bitch slap Sylvester Stallone on the set of The Lords of Flatbush. Instead, Gere droped a cold chicken thigh on Stallone. The rest is cinema history.

title: Fact #6
text: Screen Actors Guild accountant Mervin Eldd was the first to suggest that the SAG excise Wesley Snipes’ footprints from the forecourt of Grauman’s Chinese Theater following allegations of tax evasion. The Guild unanimously ratified and executed Eldd’s suggestion within days of Snipes’ first appeal. Upon Snipes’ death in 2011, fellow pituitary midget and hotrod enthusiast Neil Young bought that segement of the sidewalk and installed it in one of his many garages in British Columbia, where it remains to this day, despite public protests by the Snipes Estate. Wesley Snipes was survived by his father, Lloyd Dooddee III, and by estate executor Richard Simmons, whose own footprints outside Grauman’s once overlooked Snipes’.

title: Fact #7
text: A spokesman for the Red Lobster Seafood chain throughout the 1990s, Wesley Snipes later denied any involvement with the company. According to Snipes’ former publicist, Michael Devadi, Snipes had once been offered work for Red Lobster at the height of his career but refused it. Following Snipes’ death in prison, Devadi changed his official stance on Snipes’ Red Lobster work.

title: Fact #8
text: Wesley Snipes’ original stage name, Delyle Butts, was taken from Delyle Snipes, a late uncle, and John Lee Butts, a Puerto Rican numbers runner who supplied Snipes with his first Koran.

title: Fact #9
text: In the Mile High Lounge of the Jean Lesange International Airport in Quebec, on a return trip from American Samoa, Wesley Snipes sipped from Celine Dion’s drink.

title: Fact #10
text: In 2009, Wesley Snipes borrowed $10 from Jason “Jam-Master Jay” Mizell of Run-D.M.C. to purchase a pair of house sandals.

title: Fact #11
text: In prison Wesley Snipes became an avid potter. A retrospective of his works — casts of his own feet and genitals — will be held at the American Folk Art Museum in New York City in fall 2014.

title: Fact #12
text: At the age of fourteen Snipes defeated heavy-weight boxing legend Joe Frazier at ping-pong in the San Juan Boys’ Club in Puerto Rico, where Snipes, on probation for truancy, maintained a snow cone concession. Snipes later claimed he had cheated by loading his paddle. A similar complaint would be brought against Snipes years later by martial arts legend Steven Seagal, who confronted Snipes at his own bankruptcy party in Chisnau, Moldova.

title: Fact #13
text: On the set of Mo’ Better Blues, Wesley Snipes measured his own penis at fourteen inches, in a flaccid state. Snipes would later claim that he had the only member in Hollywood which could fit in both of his front pockets simultaneously. Upon his death in 2011, it was confirmed that Snipes, who died with an erection, had a penis three times the length of his head. This is not uncommon among pituitary midgets.

title: Fact #14
text: Before he was drawn to acting, Wesley Snipes studied kitchen design in Vevey, Switzerland. He was known to re-arrange his kitchen twice a year.

title: Fact #15
text: Wesley Snipes’ mother, Eleanor Yabwe, was a Yoruban voodoo priestess.

title: Fact #16
text: Wesley Snipes was a beloved prison racconteur known throughout his pod for his spoken word interpretation of Christmas with Burl Ives.

title: Fact #17
text: Prior to his death in 2011 in a prison tax revolt, Wesley Snipes prided himself on the fact that he had never paid for a pair of shoes. This was confirmed in an interview with Michigan-born funny man Sinbad at Snipes’ funeral in Cuidad Navidad, Puerto Rico, though in terms that Richard Simmons, who now manages the Snipes Estate, explicitly condemned.

title: Fact #18
text: According to cycling champion George Hincapie, the “nègre mystérieux” bulging with human growth hormone documented by French TV crews during Stage 15 of the Tour de France in 2002 was Wesley Snipes. Snipes, Hincapie later testified, pedaled half of Lance Armstrong’s climb of Mount Ventoux before driving his bicycle into the bushes, out of which popped a superbly rested Armstrong.

title: Fact #19
text: Wesley Snipes’ infamous “twelve o’clock rule,” according to which any leftover catering was his at the stroke of midnight, was a source of confusion and later set-wide discord during the filming of Timeline Mayo.

title: Fact #20
text: Wesley Snipes only had one foot.

title: Fact #21
text: According to Wesley Snipes, director Robert Zemeckis never mistook him for a doorman at the Ritz-Carlton Grand Cayman. Rather, it was Snipes himself who mistook Zemeckis for Zemeckis’ second cousin Claude Zemeckis, a shady tort lawyer who was managing Snipes’ financial portfolio at the time.

title: Fact #22
text: Just days before his death in prison, Wesley Snipes committed to a prison reality show showcasing his efforts to become the number one prison barber in his pod. The pilot for Rough Cuts was shown in a minimum security prison in Belize, where Snipes had once maintained a summer home, and in Puerto Rico.

title: Fact #23
text: Wesley Snipes’ single, ¡Muy Valoroso!, a tribute to the late Harry Belafonte, sold over one million copies in Sweden.

title: Fact #24
text: Days of Havoc, a Kid Rock-helmed documentary following the hijinks of Snipes and his prison friend “Prince” Ted Naylor on the days leading up to the Snipes-led minimum security prison revolt in FCI McKean, was rumored to have interested Harvey Weinstein and the Weinstein Group briefly. At the bargaining table, however, Weinstein pulled out when it was brought to his attention that Snipes was dead.

title: Fact #25
text: Snipes, a notorious prankster, once set director Bob Fosterman’s seat cushion on fire while Fosterman was directing the climactic final sequence of the 1999 cult film The Bilking of Margolis. Speculation is rampant as to why or how Snipes, who had no part in the movie, was on the set to begin with.

title: Fact #26
text: Wesley Snipes didn’t learn how to read until the age of forty-six.

title: Fact #27
text: A lifelong Hot Wheels aficionado, Snipes had amassed more than twenty-two miles of racing track in his mansion in Cuidad Navidad, Puerto Rico, more than a third of which was moved to his prison cell when Snipes pleaded guilty to eighty-two counts of tax felony in 2009.<sup>1</sup>
notes: 1Glimpses of Snipes’ prison race track can be seen in the Kid Rock documentary Days of Havoc, but only in the director’s cut.

title: Fact #28
text: After the critical box office failure of The Wiz in 1978, Sidney Lumet offered Wesley Snipes the role of Pinocchio in his inner-city version of the classic Italian fairy tale. It was the only role Snipes ever regretted turning down.

title: Fact #29
text: According to Quinlan’s Abridged Dictionary of Film Facts (2008 edition), Wesley Snipes was the only black pituitary midget to have starred in a vampire trilogy.

title: Fact #30
text: In the notorious footage of Wesley Snipes’ final moments in the 2011 FCI McKean minimum security prison revolt, a stealthy figure thought to be Swedish tax evader Ulike Lundgren (brother of Dolph) is seen stepping over Snipes’ asphixiated corpse in his bare feet. According to Snipes’ then-agent Michael Devadi, who was the first to positively identify Snipes’ body in the prison garbage chute, it was indeed Lundgren. Devadi further claimed that Lundgren was the only inmate in Snipes’ wing who offered to help retrieve Snipes’ corpse from the garbage chute, earning him a spot on the funeral planning committee. Lundgren, witnesses remember, was also the original suggester of the rotating casket video featuring a voice-over by Alonso “Hamburger” Jones.

title: Fact #31
text: Wesley Snipes was a licensed distributor of CocoMax, a coconut-based scalp rejuvenator invented in Puerto Rico in 1979 by Doctor Salvator Benelingue. When alive, Snipes participated in two of the doctor’s wildly popular American infomercials, appearing in the “after” footage only.

title: Fact #32
text: Wesley Snipes hated rice and even the idea of rice.

title: Fact #33
text: During filming of the Sammy Davis, Jr. biopic Life of the Party (post-production) on location in prison, Snipes famously refused voice coach Steve Donovan’s training, instead hiring Delroy Lindo to dub his lines in Barbadian. Critics of Lindo’s West Indian take on Davis’ speech have likened Snipes’ creative license to Ray Liotta’s infamous, short-run Hamlet Prince of Bensonhurst.

title: Fact #34
text: Hollywood guru to the stars Mohan Mohan was once seen with Wesley Snipes at the Vegas Seafood Buffet in Glendale, California. Close friends of Mohan Mohan later claimed that Mohan Mohan complained for months after the encounter that Snipes had casually removed food from his plate with an extendable fork.

title: Fact #35
text: Prior to his death by stampede and then decapitation<sup>1</sup> in the ill-fated minimum-security prison revolt of which he was the chief instigator and captain, Wesley Snipes had accumulated over 300 shoe boxes’ worth of pipe cleaner in a variety of colors and resistances. According to Mike Lopane, a fellow collector, Snipes’ pipe cleaner collection was “impressive.”
notes: <sup>1</sup>Snipes’ corpse was discovered days after the fact in the prison garbage chute alongside his prison friend “Prince” Ted Naylor and pod boss Boris Carradine. An autopsy later revealed that Snipes had been decapitated and his head replaced with a lifelike wax replica.

title: Fact #36
text: For his on-stage saxophone scenes as Shadow Henderson in Spike Lee’s Mo’ Better Blues, Wesley Snipes, a pituitary midget, was hoisted into the air by a complex web of cables and hasps attached to his suits via special shoulder flaps. When he wasn’t elevated in this way, Lee made sure to hold the camera at a tilt when filming Snipes from below, an effect veteran film critics would later mistakenly ascribe to Shadow Henderson’s “pretentiousness.”

title: Fact #37
text: On the set of Duane Roger Bliss, Eric Roberts reported to at least three of the eight producers of the film that Wesley Snipes had made him sleep in a tent prior to shooting the notorious cabin scene in which Roberts’ character Roy “Big Meadow” Narrows is harassed and then forced to flee his home on a flaming mattress equipped with a faulty outboard motor. Snipes’ agent at the time, Michael Devadi, claimed otherwise, insisting that the “tent clause” was 1) a contractual obligation Roberts was well aware of prior to shooting, and 2) no different from the tent clauses stipulated in any Snipes-produced film. Shooting on Duane Roger Bliss was postponed in 2009 when Snipes was incarcerated for eighty-two counts of tax evasion and two counts of grand larceny. Upon Snipes’ death and decapitation and the retrieval of his corpse from a Pennsylvania minimum security prison garbage chute, the role of Duane Roger Bliss was offered to Alfonso Ribeiro.

title: Fact #38
text: In 1987, when fellow African American midget Emmanuel Lewis was nominated for Exceptional Performance by a Young Actor Starring in a Television Comedy or Drama Series and lost to seventeen-year-old Kirk Cameron, Wesley Snipes famously boycotted the award, sending Cameron a cellophane-wrapped gifts of his own feces in the mail from a P.O. box in Melverton, Barbados. Cameron would later cite this episode as grist for his infamous “mo’ better n*****” remark at a Waffle House in Krafton, Illinois, which cost him both his award and his starring role on Growing Pains. Cameron and Snipes eventually reconciled their differences in 1991 on the set of New Jack City, when Cameron auditioned for, but ultimately failed to land, the roles of Kid on a Stoop Four and Recovering Addict Two.

title: Fact #39
text: It is said that for the role of Roemello Skuggs in Sugar Hill Wesley Snipes learned to chew food on the left side of his mouth.

title: Fact #40
text: An original investor in, and spokesman for, Menthorice, a nicotine-infused, menthol-flavored licorice candy, Wesley Snipes quickly assumed full credit for the invention of the product down to its unique chemical formula, nudging out collaborator Bo-Rat Winslow, a Mississippian. In prison, prior to his asphyxiation, impaling, beheading, and the eventual replacement of his head with a life-like replica, Snipes apologized to Winslow, who notoriously spat on Snipes’ missing right foot.

title: Fact #41
text: When VICE co-creator Ryan Duffy first heard of Wesley Snipes’ decapitation in the now-infamous Snipes-led FCI McKean minimum security prison revolt, he asked NBA great Dennis Rodman to accompany him and Shane Smith to Pyongyang to meet with North Korean leader Kim Jong-un. It was only after days of nearly futile bargaining that Kim Jong-un, whose official titles included World’s Most Esteemed and Glorious Fan of Wesley Snipes, accepted the last-minute exchange. According to Duffy, Kim Jong-un’s offer to host and then add Snipes’ head to his collection of Snipes memorabilia was only partly true.

title: Fact #42
text: Wesley Snipes was shot in the hand by his chauffeur and common-law wife Jelatine Moody<sup>1</sup> while adjusting the antenna of his 1987 Cadillac Fleetwood, which had stopped working at traffic lights.
notes: <sup>1</sup>Daughter of Duncan Moody, the mobility scooter mogul

title: Fact #43
text: Before shooting their ill-fated Star Trek parody training video, the IRS had originally conceived of a public service announcement read by Wesley Snipes from the prison shower.

title: Fact #44
text: Wesley Snipes was a comedian’s comedian.

title: Fact #45
text: In Puerto Rico there is a cigar named after Wesley Snipes. According to Snipes’ stepfather, Doodee Snipes, that cigar is actually Cuban.

title: Fact #46
text: In many villages in Afghanistan and Pakistan the most popular baby name, regardless of sex, is Wesley Snipes.

title: Fact #47
text: Wesley Snipes once put out a fire with his teeth.

title: Fact #48
text: Wesley Snipes was the first inmate of a U.S. minimum security prison to sit on death row for tax evasion. Snipes’ sentence was eventually commuted to eight concurrent life sentences, of which he served six years before his death.

title: Fact #49
text: Kid Rock’s prison-made The Drying Line, starring Wesley Snipes as Rudy Bucket, a low-level IRS informant suffering from genital lupus, was shot entirely inside FCI McKean.

title: Fact #50
text: The Ben and Jerry’s ice cream flavor “Snippity Snipes” was recalled the day it hit stores in May 1993 when critics claimed the triple chocolate fudge ice cream resembled “an asphalt road on a moonless night punctuated here and there by bright white marshmallow teeth.”

title: Fact #51
text: While in prison for tax evasion, Wesley Snipes amassed a small fortune in favors by selling his Delta sky miles to unsuspecting prisoners. According to U.S. law, it’s illegal for former felons to collect sky miles.

title: Fact #52
text: In 2005, Wesley Snipes was inducted into Cleveland’s prestigious Helion Society, then the premier club for African-American actors of Barbadian descent. Controversy erupted four years later when, in the society’s annual members letter, Snipes’ current employment was listed as “prisoner.” Snipes’ publicist Michael Devadi cancelled Snipes’ membership immediately, an ultimately futile gesture as the label stuck. A year later Snipes was dead. The Helion Society neglected to include a Snipes obituary in that year’s members letter, referring to Snipes dismissively as a “greedy Floridian dwarf.” Snipes was a pituitary midget.

title: Fact #53
text: Herve Villechaize once challenged Wesley Snipes to an arm-wrestling match in his bathtub.

title: Fact #54
text: Oprah Winfrey, Wesley Snipes’ aunt through a third marriage, is also a pituitary midget.

title: Fact #55
text: At the urging of fellow snow cone vendor Jerome “Papa” Wedi, Wesley Snipes applied for his first Mensa membership in San Juan, Puerto Rico, at the age of sixteen. He was rejected. He periodically reapplied throughout his life, including during his incarceration. Snipes’ total number of Mensa rejections, 196, earned him a Golden Hermes paperweight, which when brandished at participating restaurants within the continental United Sates, entitled Snipes to ten-percent discounts on his bills and to free desserts.

title: Fact #56
text: Wesley Snipes met future collaborator Guillermo del Toro at Hundred Acre Links in Nesbit, Utah, where Snipes was del Toro’s caddy. According to del Toro’s brother-in-law Gene Hinkel, a Mormon property developer, Snipes was a mediocre and often unwilling helper.

title: Fact #57
text: Wesley Snipes was born D. Neville Butts to Betty Arias, a washwoman, and Lloyd Doodee III, an itinerant Salvation Army trumpeter visiting Puerto Rico from Mississippi.

title: Fact #58
text: According to fellow prankster and Hollywood little man Emmanuel Lewis, Wesley Snipes was not invited to Camille Paglia’s 60th birthday party on Fire Island.

title: Fact #59
text: A recreational user of Certs, Snipe’s go-to breath fresheners while on set were jelly-filled hospitality mints.

title: Fact #60
text: In a rousing speech given just days before the minimum security prison revolt in which he perished in the prison garbage chute, Wesley Snipes referred to President Barack Obama, who had refused to pardon him, as “that house nigger.”

title: Fact #61
text: According to his own genealogical research, Snipes was related on the Doodee side of the family to Billy Bowlegs III, a.k.a Billy Fewell, a.k.a Cofehapkee, a Seminole wise man and pituitary midget.

title: Fact #62
text: In the ill-fated Ron Howard riverboat odyssey Long Rain Coming, Wesley Snipes was to play laconic innkeeper Johnny Fiver, who only spoke in Welsh riddles.

title: Fact #63
text: When traveling in inclement weather, Wesley Snipes preferred a two-piece rain outfit, generally a khaki rubber coat and bucket hat.

title: Fact #64
text: Wesley Snipes was not a Rhodes Scholar.
tags: midget celebrities who weren’t Rhodes scholars

title: Fact #65
text: It is said that Wesley Snipes achieved total ketosis at least twice in his life.

title: Fact #66
text: Days into shooting Bad Inc., Christopher Lambert’s French valet Louis Cormand refused Wesley Snipes entrance onto the set after confusing Snipes’ heavily truncated Porsche Cayenne for an elaborate golf cart.

title: Fact #67
text: Wesley Snipes was an early believer in Dr. Jerry Menzel’s buttocks firming machine,The Jiggler, and along with Dr. Earl Crispi, a cosmetic surgeon from Plano, Texas, became a primary investor. In a statement by Snipes’ then-agent Michael Devadi, Snipes was unaware that Menzel had modeled the concept of the Jiggler on The Weeping Buttocks Machine (transl.), an Italian buttocks toning machine available on the Italian market since 1962. The two machines were similar enough to warrant an expensive international lawsuit filed by American investors on behalf of Dr. Luigi Puisposgli, the inventor of the original Weeping Buttocks Machine. Dr. Puisposgli died before a settlement was reached, prompting Snipes to falsely report his court-ordered restitution payment to the Puisposgli Estate as a charitable donation.

title: Fact #68
text: In an 2004 interview with Telefónica Seven, a Chilean chat program, actor Charlie Sheen claimed to have never heard of Wesley Snipes.

title: Fact #69
text: For the role of Sidney Deane in White Men Can’t Jump, Wesley Snipes, a pituitary midget, wore a pair of elevator shoes designed by Dino De Laurentiis’ brother-in-law, Fred Contestis, a Mission City cobbler.

title: Alert!
text: A Wesley Snipes “Still Living Hoax” has been circulating on the Internet. To be clear: this is a hoax. Wesley Snipes is dead. He died in a minimum security prison revolt in the garbage chute of the Ban-Lon wing where life-like effigies of his body and head were recovered by lifelong collaborator and fellow pituitary midget Ethan Hawke. Snipes himself is believed to be circulating through South East Asia as a headless mummy with a string-activated voice featuring a squawky, foreign-sounding imitation of the deceased actor’s “chocolate baritone.”

title: Fact #70
text: When he was falsely identified as the “sockless ninja” on episode 198 of John Walsh’s hit TV show America’s Most Wanted, Wesley Snipes didn’t immediately sue the Fox Television Network. It was only after Walsh made repeated references to the perpetrator’s stupidity at attempting to rob a cashier at a Cheese King in Pittsboro, West Virginia, using just his naked left foot that Snipes took umbrage. The “sockless ninja” was subsequently discovered to be Rudy Bob Baker, a local miscreant.

title: Fact #71
text: Wesley Snipes’ first critically acclaimed role was his portrayal of Mr. Barudi’s one-legged helper, Little Carlos, on the long-running Puerto Rican children’s drama Avenida Zogata (The Street with Potholes), about a group of orphaned street musicians who move from town to town with Mr. Barudi performing miracles. Snipes, who was twenty-three at the time, was just coming to grips with his pituitary midgetism.

title: Fact #72
text: In Andus Sepp’s cultural biography of Wesley Snipes, The Snipes Effect, Guillermo del Toro, a Mexican pituitary midget, cited Snipes’ improvised use of a cape in his portrayal of ostracized Louisiana candy factory employeee Ed Balfour in The Last Days of Bobo Stein as the inspiration for Blade, the first vampire film to feature a caped African-American pituitary midget in a starring role.

title: Fact #73
text: Wesley Snipes was the legal child of the late Surgeon General C. Everett Koop, who met and later adopted Snipes after the two starred in a series of Department of Health public service announcements lambasting the men’s beard and mustache brush-in color gel industry.

title: Fact #74
text: To prepare himself for the role of Lenny Herrera, a legally blind astronaut lost in a space station ventilation duct for weeks, Wesley Snipes boiled and drank his own urine for three months.

title: Fact #75
text: Wesley Snipes was a close friend and supporter of Dimestore Jim Tchipitoulas, the itinerant antiques maven whose antiques obsession long predated The Antique Roadshow. Following Snipes’ arraignment for tax fraud, Tchipitoulas publicly offered to auction off his personal collection of vintage Sunbeam toasters and donate the money to the Snipes household. In total, it is believed Tchipitoulas offset Snipes’ court-ordered fines — $7 million — by $2,340, a substantial sum for Tchipitoulas, who had been living out of a Free Spirit Leisure Van since 1982.

title: Fact #76
text: In 1993, following the box office success of New Jack City, Wesley Snipes teamed up with celluloid nemesis Judd Nelson to produce a pilot for a primetime television show called Uppity Jones, in which Nelson was to play Mick Rover, an out-of-work Jewish date fixer, and Snipes Uppity Jones, a disgruntled former client of Rover’s, now divorced and sharing an apartment with Rover’s sex-crazed grandmother.

title: Fact #77
text: According to one-time publicist Michael Devadi, Wesley Snipes had read up to page 516 of the beloved Spanish classic Don Quixote (Grossman edition) numerous times only to turn back — struck by an unnamed fear — and start over again. Despite suggestions from friends and (once) from fellow African-American Hollywood (thyroidal) midget Carl Weathers to stop reading at page 515, skip 516, and pick back up at 517, Snipes, a notorious perfectionist, clung to this ultimately self-defeating approach to the book.

title: Fact #78
text: There is a Puerto Rican space opera chronicling the exploits of Wesley Snipes’ feckless efforts at tax evasion. In the opera, Big Wise Guys of the Universe, a character named “Snipes” motors to distant pockets of the universe on a pair of fusion-propelled rollerskates inciting short-lived “tax revolutions.”
tags: big wise guys of the universe

title: Fact #79
text: The original creator of the failed reality TV show Uncle was Wesley Snipes. In the show, ordinary citizens with intrapersonal grievances would challenge each other to fights in which only knuckle bending was allowed. By the time the show made it to the final round of negotiations, hitmaker Brad Filqetost refused to get involved, citing Snipes’ knuckle bending as his main objection. Filqetost would later go on to create a Survivor spinoff whose contestants were all irate supermarket managers, and Warbucks, a glipse into the thriving Milwaukee subculture of bald millionaires with adopted red-headed children.

title: Fact #80
text: Wesley Snipes was the voice of Elmo.

title: Fact #81
text: In 2009, Wesley Snipes was released from prison for four days to fly to New Delhi to shoot martial arts legend Steven Seagal’s nighttime hand scenes in the 2010 sleeper Supplanted Evidence.1
notes: 1Released in India in 2011 as Pocket Funds and in Pakistan and Bangladesh as The Curious Case of Benjamin Button 2.

title: Fact #82
text: Before he was shut down in one of Mayor Koch’s notorious shell game sting operations, Wesley Snipes performed in Greenwhich Village’s Washington Square Park as “Louis Two the Original Organ Grinder’s Monkey.” Other famous Manhattan organ grinder’s monkeys include Fyodor Dostoevsky, V.S. Naipul, and Eric Roberts, a.k.a. Louis One, the Original Organ Grinder’s Monkey.

title: Fact #83
text: In 1994, Wesley Snipes purchased a multimillion-dollar Malibu villa once owned, but never actually vacated, by actor Mickey Rourke, who continued to inhabit a room in the basement with his drum kit and legendary Hai Karate after shave collection for over a decade.

title: Fact #84
text: In a critical moment in the Richard Dreyfuss-produced screwball comedy Downtime, Wesley Snipes (Little Boy Bufus) professes a natural fondness for drapes over Venetian-style blinds. The original script called for a fondness for blinds.

title: Fact #85
text: Codename Newtown (in post-production when Wesley Snipes perished in a garbage chute during a minimum security prison revolt at FCI McKean) saw Snipes pairing off against himself as the Nigerian-born Mbongo Twins, Adelbert and Rufus Mbongo, arrested in 2003 in Marseilles and charged with defrauding over 70,000 French pensioners in a scam that came to be known as the Prince Moses of Togo Letter. Over the course of nine inter-prison visits, Snipes mastered the Mbongo’s signature mannerisms so thoroughly that once, for fun, he sucessfully escaped prison posing as both Mbongo Twins simultaneously.

title: Fact #86
text: Until his death, Wesley Snipes was the legal son of fitness guru Richard Simmons.

title: Fact #87
text: Wesley Snipes’ deeply personal one-man show, In a Manner of Speaking, was the first of its kind in Barbados. The 2001 performance acknowledged in an intimate yet amusing way Snipes’ struggles with his midgetism, which until then he had kept hidden from even his closest friends. Mariah Carey, also a midget of Barbadian descent, cited Snipes’ gutsiness in handling the subject as a major reason for her decision to leave the circus and pursue a career in Hollywood.

title: Fact #88
text: Kim Kardashian’s left buttock, Hammond Organ, was originally named after Wesley Snipes.

title: Fact #89
text: In 2011, Wesley Snipes was scheduled to appear on a special Jeopardy Tax Evaders Edition, Jeopardy host Alex Trebek’s spinoff series of extreme Jeopardy challenges, but was decapitated in prison before filming.

title: Fact #90
text: The answer to seven down on the March 23rd 2001 New York Times crossword puzzle — “African American little person half-living and half-dead” — was not, as many readers insisted, Wesley Snipes, but Gary Coleman, who had just starred in a limited engagement run of The Menials, in which he played a dwarf frozen in a life-sized cube of ice but later revived.

title: Fact #91
text: Wesley Snipes collaborated with Bruce Boxleitner on an early version of Snakefish Terror called Termite 179 in which Snipes’ character Robby Robbleroy, a retired LAPD bomb squad captain, was lured onto speeding Elder Hostel bus #179, which would be flooded with African cannibal termites should the bus slow to a speed under fifty miles per hour. According to Boxleitner, who financed early drafts of the script, Snipes refused to work with Gary Busey, Boxleitner’s choice for the psychopathic criminal mastermind behind the cannibal termites.

title: Fact #92
text: An avid James Clavell memorabilia collector, Wesley Snipes placed the winning bid (by proxy) on a Pommelroy soaking tub in which Clavell was said to have dictated an early draft of Tai Pan.

title: Fact #93
text: Snipes owned nine Nordstrom customer loyalty cards under the name Kenny Rogers.

title: Fact #94
text: During his lifetime Wesley Snipes siphoned much of his taxable wealth into Selbane Laboratories, a manufacturer of battery-operated Kwanzaa candles whose primary shareholders at the time of Snipes’ beheading were Diane Wiest and Kimbal Musk.

title: Fact #95
text: Snipes’ son Akhenaten Kihwa-T Snipes is also a pituitary midget.

title: Fact #96
text: Wesley Snipes’ cameo in Michael Jackson’s 1987 music video Bad was eventually cut on the advice of Paula Abdul over concerns that Snipes’ kung fu-inspired dancing would upstage Jackson’s. The deleted Snipes scene appears in the uncut version of Bad released after Jackson’s death. Snipes is the dancing midget in the orange parachute pants.

title: Fact #97
text: In 2009, via closed-circuit prison TV, Wesley Snipes was honored in absentia with a lifetime achievement award from the Metropolitan Detention Center in Guayanabo, Puerto Rico.

title: Fact #98
text: Wesley Snipes was a master of Pig Latin.

title: Fact #99
text: In 2002, Wesley Snipes bankrolled a reality show for Canal Nuevo in Puerto Rico called Quitting Time (English translation). Cashing in on the wild popularity of quitting shows in Sweden, Quitting Time featured unhappy Puerto Rican workers berating their abusive employers, who then chose, on the basis of the arguments they heard, to either give them a raise or accept their resignation.

title: Fact #100
text: Lil Dudley’s clone in You Say, I Say, the midget rapper’s first number-one hit in Puerto Rico, wasn’t Wesley Snipes, as many believe, but S.S. Samuels, Wesley Snipes’ stunt double.

title: Fact #101
text: In 1977, Wesley Snipes brought an Earl Scheib-like franchise called Motoya’s to San Juan, Puerto Rico, where a standard, no-frills paint job cost just $24.99. It was later discovered by vigilante accountant Oscar Ledesma that Motoya’s was actually a pyramid scheme. By late 1978, for every third citizen of Puerto Rico, two Motoya’s paint jobs were circulating.

title: Fact #102
text: With the exception of his first son, Akhenaten Kihwa-T Snipes, and his fifth son, Bartleby the Scrivener Snipes, all of Wesley Snipes’ first ten documented children are named Wesley Snipes.

title: Fact #103
text: In the hours preceding a thunderstorm, Wesley Snipes’ eyeballs weighed more than this testicles, a condition known as pituitary hypoorchidism.

title: Fact #104
text: Wesley Snipes was an avid equestrian. Following his death and decapitation in a minimum security prison revolt, his horse, a pygmy Shetland pony named Mnguni Two, was purchased by Prince Charles of England.

title: Fact #105
text: Vetted for the role of Tattoo in Return to Fantasy Island, Wesley Snipes ultimately lost out to Armand Assante, a Hodgson’s dwarf.

title: Fact #106
text: Christopher Walken’s famous sage and chestnut Kwanzaa stuffing recipe was actually Wesley Snipes’.

title: Fact #107
text: Wesley Snipes wore a size-seven slipper.

title: Fact #108
text: On the set of The Good Die Tomorrow,1 a straight-to-DVD release made from reshot outtakes from three earlier Snipes films, Wesley Snipes borrowed Tom Skerritt’s Gaetano kneepads. According to Harry Dean Stanton, Snipes never returned them.
notes: <sup>1</sup>Released in Nigeria to universal acclaim as The Apple Pie Boys.

title: Fact #109
text: Val Kilmer wore a “Free Wesley Snipes” T-shirt to the 84th Academy Awards underneath a relaxed Valentino kimono, apparently unaware that Snipes, the victim of a voodoo-inspired head shrinking in a minimum security prison revolt earlier that year, was already dead.

title: Fact #110
text: Snipes’ first wife, Linda Ng, was a pit bull trainer of Vietnamese heritage. They divorced in 1981 after Ng had tried unsuccessfully to set Snipes on fire for the fourth time. The episode was captured on video by Mickey Rourke, whose pug chihuahua mix, Little Shithouse, had been trained by Ng.

title: Fact #111
text: Wesley Snipes began his show business career as a palace mime at the summer villa of exiled Cuban dictator Fulgencio Batista.

title: Fact #112
text: In Passenger 57, Wesley Snipes is shown reading a book. The “book,” viewers have pointed out, is actually a tactical guide to duty free shopping that features, instead of European luxury goods, a seemingly endless list of diabetic South American dictators.

title: Fact #113
text: The Harris Poll ranked Wesley Snipes the second most popular black pituitary midget entertainer in 1997. Many of Snipes’ fans believe that Billy Dee Williams, the most beloved black pituitary midget of 1997, only billed himself as a pituitary midget, whereas in reality he suffered, like Carl Weathers, from a rare form of thyroidal midgetism.

title: Fact #114
text: For much of his career, Wesley Snipes owned and managed a Long John Silver’s Seafood Restaurant in Beaver, West Virginia.

title: Fact #115
text: A respected Platonist, Wesley Snipes complained constantly and bitterly to fellow classicist Eric Roberts of the “infelicities” he had discovered in the Hackforth translation of Plato’s Phaedrus.

title: Fact #116
text: In 1999, Wesley Snipes had Nat King Cole exhumed from his final resting place in Marseilles’ Cimetière des Olives and replaced with a life-size replica of Don Cheadle.

title: Fact #117
text: Sean Penn and Wesley Snipes’ 2010 update of the 1982 hit single Ebony and Ivory was the only billboard number-one single to have been cut in a minimum security prison. It was also the first hit single to feature a mixed race tandem of entertaining midgets. Penn, a Gershom’s midget, has never publicly acknowledged his midgetism within the U.S. In Venezuela and Haiti, where Penn performs stand-up comedy, Penn’s midgetism is a well-known fact.

title: Fact #118
text: A Wesley Snipes Soundboard was dubbed into Korean by South Korean comedian Camp Hoo Park in late 2012. In early 2013, the Snipes Soundboard was smuggled into the People’s Republic of North Korea on the orders of the Republic’s dwarf-dictator Kim Jong Un.

title: Fact #119
text: Wesley Snipes laminated his own urine.

title: Fact #120
text: Before a lucrative career in acting, Wesley Snipes scripted ringside banter for WWF legends Bobby “The Brain” Heenan and Randy “Macho Man” Savage.

title: Fact #121
text: From 1992 to 1994, Wesley Snipes was the host of a hit Puerto Rican television program called Happy Afternoons of the Little People (English translation), which saw Snipes and co-host Alfonso Paul arriving on the stoops of fellow Puerto Rican midgets with gifts of above-ground swimming pools and a guaranteed one-year supply of clean water. Snipes left the show in early 1994 over a contractual dispute.
tags: happy afternoons of the little people

title: Fact #122
text: In a deleted scene from Blade, Wesley Snipes was asked by director Guillermo del Toro to arrive at the headquarters of his nemesis Dragonetti (Udo Kier) in a giant trench coat on the shoulders of Kris Kristofferson, who would remain hidden under the coat until they were safely inside. When Snipes refused to sit on Kristofferson, del Toro conceived of the now legendary biplane entry in which Snipes glides into Dragonetti’s lair astride a single-seat Sopwith Camel (piloted by Kristofferson) shooting poison arrows.

title: Fact #123
text: Wesley Snipes and Mark Ruffalo are the only Puerto Rican midgets to have performed Sesame Street duets with the Count.

title: Fact #124
text: After playing Harvey Keitel’s invisible sidekick, Cranks de Foy, in Kreeger’s Alley, Snipes was offered a cameo role in I, Claudius opposite Derek Jacobi as “Unguents Peddler” in a busy street scene.

title: Fact #125
text: In 2011, Geraldo Rivera filmed the prison reunion of Wesley Snipes and estranged father Lloyd Doodee III of Herman, Mississippi. A week later, Snipes was decapitated and subsequently stuffed and booby-trapped<sup>1</sup> by prison voodooists after an unsuccessful prison tax revolt championed by Snipes and six other tax-evading prison midgets.
notes: <sup>1</sup>Snipes’ body was later discovered in the prison garbage chute by claims adjusters, who deactivated the booby trap. After touring the sideshows of Eastern Europe for a year, Snipes’ corpse was placed in a cryogenic cellar by father Doodee and Snipes’ seventh wife, Jocelyn Powers Snipes, mother of Four Wheel Drive Snipes (age two, a dwarf) and Grocery List Snipes (age four).

title: Fact #126
text: A biological enigma, only Snipes’ right foot sweated, one of three known cases<sup>1</sup> in Hollywood.
notes: <sup>1</sup>Both James Spader and Lance Henriksen (Pumpkinhead) had sweaty right feet.

title: Fact #127
text: The bright orange light emanating from Jules and Vincent’s briefcase in Pulp Fiction is neither diamonds nor Jules and Vincent’s souls. It is Wesley Snipes.

title: Fact #128
text: In the original script for Tom Cruise’s space thriller Lockdown 144, in which Cruise’s character Lieutenant David Bellows is trapped on an abandoned space station whose 144 rooms are each haunted by a virtual replica of himself, Wesley Snipes appeared in Room 26 as the wise-cracking space shaman Gimcrack.

title: Fact #129
text: Between 1995 and 1997, Wesley Snipes performed at the Gateway Dinner Theater in East Las Vegas with a Regis Philbin impersonator. Their routine, The Little Rascals Meet Abbott and Costello, was described in the Reno Casino Gazette as a “must-see.”

title: Fact #130
text: A lifelong semi-competitive Monopoly player, Wesley Snipes was credited, in the 2010 Puerto Rican Monopoly docudrama Little Dreams (of Land Ownership), with petitioning Hasboro to recognize Puerto Rico’s claims to more competitive “big money” real estate. Prior to Snipes’ advocacy, La Palqua de San Estevan, San Juan’s most expensive property, was rated at less than half the value of Baltic Avenue. Other “low rent” Monopoly countries include: Moldova, the Republic of Chad, Pakistan, Togo, Nigeria, and Dagestan, whose most expensive property, the Tarki Pass, when equipped with three hotels, is worth less than the maximum railroad fine in the Nigerian version of the game.

title: Fact #131
text: Roxane Gay, a Dobson’s midget from Papua New Guinea, was the wet nurse of Grocery List Snipes, Wesley Snipes’ third son by his seventh wife Jocelyn Powers.

title: Fact #132
text: Mel Gibson originally cast Wesley Snipes as Uchechwa, the Aztec high priest’s pastries-obsessed younger brother in his 2011 romantic comedy Apocalypto, a role which ultimately went to John Leguizamo.

title: Fact #133
text: Wesley Snipes turned down the role of Figaroa Brown, Cliff Bemis’s trash-talking midget sidekick in Hell Comes to Frogtown, to play midget hotdog vendor Rory Burke in the 1989 box office bomb Cracker Gotta Big Knife, a prequel to Crocodile Dundee set in Spanish Harlem.

title: Fact #134
text: Wesley Snipes was a close friend of animator Will Vinton. In an extended interview with the Oregon History Museum, which held a retrospective of Vinton’s work in 2008, Vinton admitted that he had considered a Jamaican reboot of his beloved Claymation Christmas Special starring Snipes as jive-talking Pupa Claus.

title: Fact #135
text: Along with Melina Mercouri, John Belushi, and Bud Preen, Wesley Snipes was an outspoken advocate for the return of the Elgin Marbles to Greece.

title: Fact #136
text: Shortly before he was beheaded by prison jihadists, Wesley Snipes had decided with longtime collaborator and adopted father Richard Simmons to resituate his Pennsylvania-based drama camp for one-handed people — Forty Acres — to Puerto Rico, where it would operate as a leper colony.

title: Fact #137
text: When Warner Bros concept man Ted Denny conceived of Judge Mathis in 1999, he originally had Wesley Snipes in mind for the part. Snipes, whose five degrees in tertiary education included a degree in jurisprudence from Louie Hines University in downtown San Juan, turned down the lucrative role to write, produce, and direct a remake of Peter Bogdonavich’s The Last Picture Show in Texas starring Rudy Ray Moore as Duane Jackson and Redd Foxx as both Sam the Lion and Ruth Popper (originally played by Cloris Leachman).

title: Fact #138
text: The playwright Wallace Shawn is the biological child of Wesley Snipes and Rosie Perez, as are actor Luiz Guzman and children’s author Stephan Erik Clark, a dwarf.

title: Fact #139
text: The role of Jodie Foster’s hand puppet in the The Beaver was originally written for Wesley Snipes.

title: Fact #140
text: In 2010, Wesley Snipes collaborated with fellow Puerto Rican little man Vin Diesel on the script for a pilot episode of The Little Princes of Pawn, a reality show about Puerto Rican pawnshop impresarios under five feet tall.

title: Fact #141
text: In 1982, Wesley Snipes, billing himself as Ray “Jelly Bean” Bustamente, fought and knocked out Puerto Rican child singing sensation Aldo in a bantam weight charity bout in Palmer City, Florida.

title: Fact #142
text: Showrunner Mensil Love originally cast Wesley Snipes as the Higgins character in ¡Ay Fossie!, a Spanish language remake of Magnum P.I. set on the Canary Islands and starring Gary Busey as Jack Fossie, an alchoholic glass-bottomed boat operator who solves crimes with his one-eyed parrot Bartholemew.

title: Fact #143
text: While on loan to Firestar Studios after breaking his contract with Paramount over Ned Balaster,1 Wesley Snipes was immediately cast as “Victim of Voodoo Head Shrinking in Afterlife Waiting Room” in the Tim Burton classic Beetlejuice..
notes: <sup>1</sup>Snipes refused to play a detective with a fear of expired milk.

title: Fact #144
text: Gary Senise’s original Of Mice and Men script had an extra part for Wesley Snipes, who was to play Honolulu Jim, Lennie Small’s deceptive older brother who attempts to con Lennie into posing as a human windsock outside his Decatur, Illinois used car lot.

title: Fact #145
text: Snipes once appeared in diapers with Danny Devito on The Novgorod Fancy Suit Gentlemen’s Dinner Club Party, Russia’s premiere late-night variety show hosted by Nav Silpenski.

title: Fact #146
text: In 1981, Wesley Snipes took out a patent for Negresh, a fabric-softening sheet for African Americans.

title: Fact #147
text: Malaysian child-dwarf Suey Park had a prison romance with Wesley Snipes prior to Snipes’ death in the ill-fated minimum security prison revolt in which Snipes perished. Their love child, Dairy Queen “Suey” Snipes, is a child genius who reputedly mentored Arthur Chu to his 2014 Jeopardy victories.

title: Fact #148
text: Following their Oscar-nominated performances in Grinders (1994) — a thinly disguised fictionalization of the lives of San Juan snowcone peddlers “Barrio” Pete Dávila and Tipitu — Brian Dennehy and Wesley Snipes toured Puerto Rico in a refrigerated Zamboni machine.

title: Fact #149
text: In 1998, together with Grinders co-star Brian Dennehy, Wesley Snipes bought controlling stock in the family entertainment center Chuck E. Cheese. According to Dennehy’s biographer, Dennehy was very pleased with his purchase and made unadvertised guest appearances in franchises around the Midwest dressed as a mouse. Snipes’ involvement in the venture was known only to close friends. In 2011, when Snipes was decapitated in a minimum security prison revolt, Snipes’ stake in the company was bought out by Asia Argento. It has since been re-sold to Orlando Bloom, a midget.

title: Fact #150
text: It was a young George Lucas1 who wrote the role of the uppity toilet bowl in Sidney Lumet’s The Wiz for Wesley Snipes, unaware that Lumet had already cast Snipes as a talking toilet in his Hispanicized retelling of Pinocchio, God Help Little Pedro (English translation). The role eventually went to a destitute Carl Weathers, a thyroidal midget who died of pneumonia before reading all his lines, at which point Lumet wrote out the talking toilet in favor of a singing scarecrow, played by Michael Jackson.
notes: <sup>1</sup>A Gibson’s dwarf

title: Fact #151
text: In the 1992 Penny Marshall plantation bro-com Spades and Tosh, crotchety Alzheimer victim and plantation owner Captain Tosh (Val Kilmer) confuses his live-in orderly Spades Bailey (Wesley Snipes) for a Union jailer. According to Marshall, the water pistol fight in the Mephis Home Depot Garden Center was entirely unscripted.

title: Fact #152
text: It was Canadian homunculus Alan Thicke who credited Wesley Snipes as the inventor of the Newman Game,<sup>1</sup> popular in Los Angeles in the late-1990s.
notes: <sup>1</sup>Where a person — the initiator — makes a statement followed by the word Newman. Play continues until someone either forgets to say Newman or says Anti-Newman, whereupon the order of speakers is reversed

title: Fact #153
text: According to an article in Mississippi Shallow Waters and Ponds Yearly recently unearthed by Richard Simmons, the executor of the Snipes Estate, Wesley Snipes’ father, Lloyd Doodee III, was a dowser with an appalling record of overcharging his customers.

title: Fact #154
text: Wesley Snipes’ stepmother Portia Doodee Snipes, a Haitian voodooist, was the daughter of a Portuguese midget and a juggling Slav from the Circus Gleich.

title: Fact #155
text: For a ten-year period in between his cameo appearance in Martin Scorsese’s Mean Streets and his breakthrough role as loveable cosmetics thief Bobby Rubies on The Young and the Restless, Wesley Snipes worked for Paul Robiforte, the Staten Island gravel mogul.

title: Fact #156
text: Wesley Snipes’ legal name was Cassian Wallace Fard Doodee I.

title: Fact #157
text: Along with his third wife Houston Astros pitcher Vern Ruhle, Wesley Snipes was an uncompromising collector of costume jade.

title: Fact #158
text: Wesley Snipes’ adopted twin brother, Grover Mt. Pleasant Doodee II, died sterilizing a fish tank a week before Snipes was killed, beheaded, and then taxidermied in prison by a cabal of prison hair stylists.

title: Fact #159
text: Like Inuit fat man Steven Seagal, Wesley Snipes was not only fluent in Russian. According to Arkady Provst, editor of Crazy Party Gossip in the Air, half of Snipes’ box office earnings were the top-grossing Russian Commisar Nevsky series in which Snipes plays the faceless, leather-gloved intelligence operative Barnell Hank.
tags: crazy party gossip in the air

title: Fact #160
text: Like fellow comedic midget Jerry Lewis, Snipes was more popular in France, where much of his work has been dubbed into French and Arabic. Though he was never inducted into the Société des Artistes, his Puerto Rican Space Opera Buffa The Multicolored Space Bus of Dr. Ricardo (English translation), in which Snipes plays Voss, a crippled Cyborg with an unidentified space sickness, is broadcast every Easter on French state TV.
tags: multicolored space bus of dr. ricardo

title: Fact #161
text: The neon fork Wesley Snipes’ character Doodad — a prophetic kimchi vendor — lent Ricardo Tubbs in Miami Vice Episode 76 “Fool’s Paradise” actually belonged to Snipes. It was a gift from his second wife, Häagen Dazs model Elena Gar. Snipes would claim up until his 2011 death in a minimum security prison revolt that Philip Michael Thomas stole the knife and lost it in a bet to Don Johnson, a Hendrick’s midget.

title: Fact #162
text: The original script for Nash Bridges Episode 22 “Wild Card” had Wesley Snipes playing Cedrick “Rick” Hawks, a dental plate repairman visiting Nash Bridges in Cork Basin, Nevada, in order to identify one of his own deceased customers. When it became known to producers that Snipes, a midget, would be driving a miniature vehicle with special raised gas and brake pedals in the climactic final chase scene, production was halted. Citing budget restrictions, CBS hired Philip Michael Thomas to play the part of Hawks, though the backstory was altered so that Hawks was a postal inspector in San Francisco sent to assassinate Bridge’s accountant Joe Dominguez (Cheech Marin). Thomas won an Emmy for his performance.

title: Fact #163
text: Wesley Snipes was the only celebrity African-American midget to have been invited onto The Wheel of Fortune twice. Snipes appeared once with Vana White, wielding a fescue, for the final puzzle, and then as a contestant on the short-lived Wheel of Fortune: Little People’s Edition.

title: Fact #164
text: The rights to Wesley Snipes’ nameless 1987 black leprechaun epic were optioned by Terrence Malick in 1990. For the next nineteen years, Malick honed and re-honed the script, eventually reaching what close friend James Lipton described as “a physical and moral exhaustion.” It wasn’t until Sean Penn and Brad Pitt were brought aboard in early 2010 that producers and backers convinced Malick to resume work. The resulting film, The Tree of Life (U.S.) and The Little Black Lucky Man and the Bottomless Pot [of Gold](Puerto Rico) — is considered to be Malick’s most ambitious and visually stunning work to date.

title: Fact #165
text: Wesley Snipes owned a small parcel of land on Sylvester Stallone’s fourteen-acre La Quinta, California property where he farmed pineapples and avocados. Snipes also had a limited stake in Stallone’s houseboat. Following Snipes’ death and subsequent taxidermification, all interest in Stallone’s Snipes-owned taxable wealth was forfeited to the US government.

title: Fact #166
text: An early believer in bulk internet banner advertising, Wesley Snipes employed a loyal prison crew of buyers and sellers who worked for him around the clock trading banner ads. It was said that upon his death, the midget actor had amassed more than $13 million in taxable banner-related funds. Richard Simmons, Snipes’ adopted father and the executor of the Snipes Estate, denied the figure, stating under oath in Tax Court, where Snipes’ case was reopened posthumously,<sup>1</sup> that Snipes had only dabbled in banners for a few months prior to his death.
notes: <sup>1</sup>Snipes, who perished in a minimum-security prison revolt in 2011, was subsequently beheaded and taxidermied. However, in a macabre twist of fate, the dead actor’s voice box still produces low-frequency sound waves approximating human speech when a straw is embedded directly in his tracheal cavity and attached to a gramophone ear.

title: Fact #167
text: Wesley Snipes’ prison nickname was “Salad,” a reference to the millions of untaxable US dollars Snipes had secreted in off-shore Barbadian “lettuce” accounts.

title: Fact #168
text: Wesley Snipes was a volunteer fireman in Yuba City, California. His vehicle — a modified Shriner parade car with a water-dispensing owl — has since been donated to the Shriners of Panama City, on display daily at the Abou Saad Shrine.

title: Fact #169
text: Lieutenant Vincent Boobichaw, Al Pacino’s character in Heat, was originally written as a feisty black midget with attitude problems. Wesley Snipes was given first look at the script and immediately made corrections — most notably, recasting Val Kilmer as a court typist with congenital syphilis. Fearing shooting delays, Michael Mann and his legal team altered the character description to read: “a feisty Italian-American midget who shouts.” Pacino, who is a Cuban Gypsy, signed on within the week.

title: Fact #170
text: To prepare for the role of Elgin Fidus, the zircon appraiser in Matt Dillon’s Dust, the low-budget 1996 biopic of Zales’ founders Morris and William Zale, Wesley Snipes lived out of a ticket booth in the Frank R. Lautenberg (Secaucus Junction) Station for eight months.

title: Fact #171
text: Deaf since birth, Wesley Snipes learned to lip read at the age of forty-two.

title: Fact #172
text: For the last year of his incarceration, Wesley Snipes shared a cell with Azerbaijani pituitary midget Norman Reedus, his adopted nephew and co-star in the 1996 Zale Brothers biopic Dust.

title: Fact #173
text: In her unauthorized biography, The Most Beautiful Woman, Elizabeth Taylor recalls an outtake from Tom Selleck’s 1988 directorial debut Point Morgan, in which she berates a “colored boom operator” for cutting in line at the craft service table. According to novelist Paul Auster, who wrote the script, Taylor was actually yelling at Wesley Snipes, an extra.

title: Fact #174
text: Wesley Snipes once called Geraldo Rivera “worse than whitey.”

title: Fact #175
text: In his fanciful adaptation of Arthur Miller’s The Death of a Salesman, Boris Vian added Willy Loman’s Conscience as a character just days before he mysteriously vanished. Vian was quickly replaced by Fred “Rerun” Berry. It was Berry who invited fellow Good Times alumnus Wesley Snipes aboard, casting him as Loman’s Evil Conscience.1
notes: 1Loman’s Good Conscience was played by Matthew Broderick for the first week and then by Val Kilmer. When Berry died of a heart attack three weeks later, Kilmer took over the director’s reins. Snipes, who had artistic differences with Kilmer during the filming of the Penny Marshall-helmed plantation bro-com Spades and Tosh, quit and was replaced by Siri Hustvedt. Boris Vian was never seen again.

title: Fact #176
text: Among Wesley Snipes’ possessions at the time of his death and subsequent taxidermification was a 1962 translation of the I Ching dedicated to Snipes by Ed Asner, who starred with Snipes in Sylvester Stallone’s 1985 musical adaptation of the love sonnets of William Shakespeare. Actuaries hired by fitness guru Richard Simmons, the executor of the Snipes Estate, valued the book at $1000. It was eventually purchased for $29 as one item on a lot of Snipe’s prison memorabilia, which included Snipes’ Espertanto dictionary, mechanical anus, and his pipe cleaner collection, by Snipes’ cellmate Norman Reedus and adopted nephew.

title: Fact #177
text: On October 5th, 1981, Wesley Snipes, an accomplished fifer, performed with Bubba Smith on the Late Show with Johnny Carson. Smith played drums.

title: Fact #178
text: In George Lucas’ original Star Wars: The Empire Strikes Back script, Boba Fett was a jaded casino employer at an interstellar casino where Han Solo won trifling but frequent sums of money. Disenchanted by what he felt was a dead-end career, Fett went on to the more lucrative profession of bounty hunting, purchasing a R2D2-like droid named Boris to accompany him on his assignments. Wesley Snipes, a pituitary midget, read for the part of Boris and was championed fiercely by Lucas, who had earlier cast Snipes as the trash-talking toilet bowl in Sidney Lumet’s The Wiz. According to fitness guru Richard Simmons, the part eventually went to Morris Coleman, brother of midget Gary, and then was dropped from the script entirely.

title: Fact #179
text: Wesley Snipes was an outspoken believer in the Sherkin Mackerel Diet and appeared in several of Sir Lloyd Sherkin’s popular infomercials prior to Sherkin’s arrest and imprisonment for tax fraud.

title: Fact #180
text: Wesley Snipes’ marriage to second wife Brigitte Neilson ended quickly in divorce with Neilson citing Snipe’s unrelenting demands for piggyback rides as an unreconciable difference.

title: Fact #181
text: In an interview with Hollywood insider Andrew O’Hehir, Kurt Russell admitted that it was Wesley Snipes who crawled under the table and bit him on the ankle at Goldie Hawn’s fiftieth birthday party in Portales, New Mexico.

title: Fact #182
text: For much of the 1970s, after a partial vasectomy which reduced his plasma production, Snipes was a human crash dummy for Volvo.

title: Fact #183
text: X-Men Bloopers, a popular Barbadian reality show, featured outtakes from the popular X-Men franchise into which Wesley Snipes had been posthumously inserted

title: Fact #184
text: Taiwanese karaoke champion Iggy Azalea is the daughter of Margot Seinfeld and Wesley Snipes.

title: Fact #185
text: The extended nine-minute “Ryan Gosling Moobs” tape in which an unidentified caller from Puerto Rico with access to Gosling’s private telephone number pretends to be a private detective looking for Gosling’s “moobs” was neither Wesley Snipes nor fellow midget Norman Reedus, Snipes’ prison cellmate and adopted nephew, as had long been believed.

title: Fact #186
text: Of Wesley Snipes’ twenty-nine living children, only two — Paul Butterfield Band Snipes and Hoegaarden Bistro Snipes — went on to become actors.

title: Fact #187
text: Legless Russian dwarf Vladimir Putin visited Wesley Snipes in prison days before the the Lewis Run Tax Evaders Prison Revolt of 2011, in which Snipes was captured in a net, melted into ingots, and deposited in a Swiss bank account by adopted father Richard Simmons for future disposition. It is believed that Putin encouraged Snipes, through a translator, to deposit himself in Switzerland.

title: Fact #188
text: Lionel Richie estimates that he spent anywhere between $10,000 and $35,000 on denatured alcohol over the course of the “hair bomb” war he waged against Wesley Snipes in the early 1990s. While Snipes instigated the first attack (setting Richie’s hair alight at a stoplight in Port Hueneme), it was Richie who lit Snipes on fire three times over the course of the shooting of the second Blade movie.

title: Fact #189
text: In 1998, the year Seamus Heaney became the first Irish astronaut to successfully complete a space walk, Snipes’ hip-hop label Cobra Records released a deluxe box set of the rare Heaney-Larkin Medicine Show Hour, in which the two esteemed poets improvise poetic exchanges as “Bucky” and “Bojangles,” two elderly Mississippi field hands.

title: Fact #190
text: In 1989, on the wings of his Burbage fame, Wesley Snipes launched a short-lived line of little men’s ankle coats for sale exclusively at the Men’s Wearhouse.

title: Fact #191
text: In 1991, in protest against Reverend Osingbe Sunday’s offensive treatment of Reverend Jesse Jackson on Jackson’s Togo Today Reconciliation Tour, Wesley Snipes ate one hundred Arby’s roast beef sandwiches — the number of psychological switches Reverend Jackson accused Reverend Sunday of landing upon his back.

title: Fact #192
text: It was Lawrence Leto, brother of Jared, a Guatemelan midget, who once mistook Wesley Snipes for Randy Quaid at a Bronson Pinchot pontoon party. Leto, who talked to a Quaid-Snipes character for at least twenty minutes, claimed his confusion stemmed from the fact that a) Quaid had appeared in his infamous C. Everett Koop disguise that night, and b) both Quaid and Snipes had just starred in the Atom Egoyan dystopian Canadian lumberjack drama The Ravaged Lake.

title: Fact #193
text: From 1997 to 2003, Wesley Snipes was the official face of King Oscar Sardines.

title: Fact #194
text: The 2004 update of The Million Dollar Man — with Steve Buscemi as General Cush and Jerry O’Connell playing Steve Austin — was cancelled when Wesley Snipes, Austin’s midget pool man, walked off the set in the third week of production. According to executive producer Matt Damon, O’Connell had referred to Snipes’ character, Lieutenant Lloyd Foist, as the “Five Hundred Dollar Man” over dinner one night. Snipes hadn’t gone public with his midgetism yet.

title: Fact #195
text: In an interview with Andrew O’Hehir in the Criterion Collection’s remastered edition of Demolition Man, Wesley Snipes cited Maurice Evans’ interpretation of Dr. Zaius in The Planet of the Apes as the basis for his portrayal of “miniaturized” car thief Simon Phoenix.

title: Fact #196
text: A analogical wax replica of Wesley Snipes based on Frank Stallone’s body measurements stands at the entrance of Madame Tussaud’s in London opposite the Josh Brolin Goonies Dummy.

title: Fact #197
text: In 1969, at the age of sixteen, Snipes had a brief role as “The Lowrider” in Riders of the Musk, a Canadian pornographic Western directed by fellow midget Atom Egoyan.

title: Fact #198
text: According to a 2013 complaint filed by the state of New Hampshire, where Wesley Snipes operated a chain of celebrity dog grooming parlors, Snipes still owes state income tax amounting to $18.10. New Hampshire is the fourth state to come forward with income tax violations against Snipes following his 2011 death in a minimum security prison revolt.

title: Fact #199
text: Wesley Snipes loved buckets.

title: Fact #200
text: Before he achieved fame as “The Lowrider,” the midget carnival barker/sexual masseur in the Atom Egoyan pornographic western trilogy Riders of the Musk (Riders of the Musk, Riders of the Musk 2: Lobo’s Revenge, and Diggin’), Wesley Snipes was known throughout Puerto Rico as the face of Grandy’s Dandies,a tobacco-flavored lollipop associated with the thriving midget population of San Juan in the 1980s.

title: Fact #201
text: Josh Brolin is a midget.

title: Fact #202
text: The “sexy sevens” referred to in the Wesley Snipes-Josh Brolin dry cleaning duet in Atom Egoyan’s The Gray Curtain was actually Brolin’s shoe size. Snipes, who suffered from acromegaly, was a size fifteen though he stood just under four feet tall.

title: Fact #203
text: In 2002, Wesley Snipes starred opposite hot-headed homunculus Christian Slater in the Christopher Nolan time travel bro-com thriller Little Daddies. In the film, Slater, a repeat sperm donor with a comic book obsession, is confronted by seven of his progeny from the future (all played by Wesley Snipes) who have traveled back in time to kill him. In an unprecedented twist that divided critics at the time, Slater, actually a detective from an intergalactic abortion agency, turns out to be Snipes’ son, too. Celebrated for its “sweeping visual style” and “nuanced portrayal of midget time travelers,” Little Daddies was eventually released in Japan, where it became the top-grossing film of the year.

title: Fact #204
text: After his comeback as Mr. Whipple’s Evil Conscience in the 2008 Charmin Toilet Paper campaign, Don Johnson was offered a supporting role in James Franco’s low-budget production of Flannery O’Connor’s A Good Man Is Hard to Find. In Franco’s inventive script, all the main characters were to be played by men dressed as mice or mice dressed as men. In prison at the time, Wesley Snipes was signed on to play “a midget.” Fearing a confrontation,1 Johnson walked off the set. He was later accidentally cast by Franco as Nat DuBois in Franco’s twenty-minute parkour version of Tennessee Williams’ A Streetcar Named Desire.
notes: 1Both actors auditioned for the voice of the toilet bowl in Sydney Lumet’s The Wiz, a part which Snipes ultimately won, but which was later cut from the film.

title: Fact #205
text: Capitalizing on the success of “Chuck Norris Facts,” the Wesley Snipes Estate launched “Reverend Desmond Tutu Facts” in 2011. Reverend Tutu, a midget, filed a lawsuit against Snipes in 2012, unaware that Snipes had already been taxidermied in a prison tax revolt. Tutu has since dropped the suit against Snipes and refiled against Richard Simmons, the Wesley Snipes Estate executor and legal father of Snipes at the time of Snipes’ taxidermification.

title: Fact #206
text: Wesley Snipes’ paternal great-grandfather, Gamaleel Snipes, was a pygmy chieftain.

title: Fact #207
text: Harold Becker’s original Taps script was a reworking of Werner Herzog’s Even Dwarves Started Small set on a rural Native American reservation where government agents threaten to shut down a single roulette machine run by local Ho-Chunk midgets. According to Becker’s notes, Wesley Snipes was to have played Ho-Chunk chief Sam “Weewee” Wasabit, a role that would eventually be rewritten for George C. Scott.

title: Fact #208
text: Wesley Snipes’ final collaboration with Inuit funny man Steven Seagal, Manhole Man, was released in Romania and the Republic of Moldova with limited box office returns. In the film, Snipes’ character, Manhole, is a retired CIA operative living in the sewers of Bucharest who must “re-educate” ex-gangster Lou Diamond Phillips (played by Seagal) in the arts of subterranean warfare. Seagal later claimed that he was unaware at the time of writing of the existence of an American actor named Lou Diamond Phillips. Phillips, a Nicaraguan midget, would later sue both actors for brand infringement.

title: Fact #209
text: On the heels of their second collaboration, Panza,1 Wesley Snipes and Val Kilmer each made an initial $2-million investment to franchise a Shugie’s Barbecue Shack restaurant in Detroit. Due to the fiscal mismanagement of Kilmer’s brother-in-law, Al Toomey, an on-again, off-again bookkeeper, Shugie’s went bankrupt within the year.
notes: <sup>1</sup> A picaresque epic set in inner-city Detroit and told through the eyes of a bedridden shoe salesman (Snipes). Filmed entirely in Barbadian.

title: Fact #210
text: Wesley Snipes was raised on Autrey’s Seafood Batter and buttermilk.

title: Fact #211
text: In 1979, Lawrence “Gas House” Snipes, a maternal uncle, bought The Distinguished Gentleman All-Day House in Macon, Georgia, the first establishment of its kind in the deep south to offer pedicures to non-commissioned African-American naval officers.

title: Fact #212
text: Wesley Snipes was born on a stool in the Tropicana Laundromat in San Juan, Puerto Rico.

title: Fact #213
text: Wesley Snipes and Janice Joplin were paternal cousins.

title: Fact #214
text: In the last minutes of his life, in a delirium, Wesley Snipes admitted to his cellmate and adopted nephew Norman Reedus to having shot Lee Harvey Oswald.

title: Fact #215
text: Wesley Snipes turned down the role of Runt, an incontinent jazz saxophonist, in Mario Van Peebles’ Gazelle, the biopic of “Gazelle Man” Siegfried Arkashian.

title: Fact #216
text: Wesley Snipes used the singular “pant” as a collective noun.

title: Fact #217
text: In the late 1980s, Wesley Snipes slept in a refrigerator box for a week before all of “Iron” Mike Tyson’s major pay-per-view bouts.

title: Fact #218
text: Wesley Snipes’ favorite meal was Brittany mussels fried in Bartles and Jaymes’ Sun Peak Peach wine cooler.

title: Fact #219
text: Wesley Snipes was the first black midget in Hollywood to appear in a Nudie suit. His portrayal of Buffalo Jim Crake, the rodeo clown/WW2 code talker, in Sparky earned Snipes his first Oscar nomination, at the age of twenty-two.

title: Fact #220
text: Wesley Snipes’ eleventh son, Wesley Jr. Lemon Scented Palmolive Snipes, will play “Chubby,” an underwater vampire, in Spike Lee’s new vampire film Dat Sweet Blood.
tags: wesley jr. lemon scented palmolive snipes

title: Fact #221
text: New evidence from Frank Stallone’s oral memoir Man in the Shadows suggests that Wesley Snipes, who was legally deaf, was coached extensively by Burt Young in his early roles. According to Stallone, Young, a mute, communicated with Snipes through a homemade ear pipe.

title: Fact #222
text: To prove a point to an irate Emmanuel Lewis, Wesley Snipes once ate a Webster’s New World Dictionary.

title: Fact #223
text: Months before his death, Wesley Snipes appeared alongside a bed-ridden Max Von Sydow in an unreleased Eric Roberts film about a worldwide flea infestation.

title: Fact #224
text: In 2011, Spike Lee issued a Wesley Snipes Commemorative Stamp. While not recognized in the Continental U.S., the Snipes Stamp is valid postal currency in Hawaii and Puerto Rico, as well as in Uruguay, Costa Rica, Nicaragua, Senegal, the Ivory Coast, and Nigeria.

title: Fact #225
text: Early in his career Wesley Snipes threatened late-night talk show host Tom Snyder with a plate of melted cheese he claimed was a melted white man. Snyder, who humored Snipes, finished the interview under the assumption that Snipes had killed and melted a man and brought the remains to the CBS studio on a plate.

title: Fact #226
text: Wesley Snipes’ original breakdancing troupe, Little W and the Air Attack, disappeared in Los Mochis, Mexico, en route to the Magic Sands Family Hotel in Acapulco in 1992. They were last seen heading West in a dump truck. Snipes, who never traveled with the troupe, arrived in Acapulco a day later by remote control helicopter.
tags: little w and the air attack

title: Fact #227
text: After learning to read at the age of forty-six, Wesley Snipes became an avid follower of the Carlton Fisk Speed Reading Method, or the Fisk Method. Fisk and Snipes exchanged many emails detailing interpretations of the finer points of the Fisk Method throughout Snipes’ incarceration at Guantanamo Bay. When Fisk died in a rubber cementing accident in 2008, Snipes assumed control of the successful speed reading franchise with majority approval (thirty-one percent) coming from the Fisk Estate. In 2011, in the wake of Snipes’ prison tanninization and subsequent bottling as a fine wine, the Fisk Method and the Two-Minute Fisk Method passed into the hands of fitness guru Richard Simmons, the executor of the Snipes Estates and Snipes’ legal father.

title: Fact #228
text: Wesley Snipes’ ninth wife, Freida Komay, died in a freak timeshare accident.

title: Fact #229
text: In an extended interview with James Lipton, Wesley Snipes discussed the difficulties of starring in ET as a virtual unknown.

title: Fact #230
text: A lawsuit on behalf of over 1,000 former Black Entertainment Television employees cites Snipes as the originator of the Dahomey Witch Hazel Hemorrhoid Removal Technique, which plagued channel executives for most of the 1990s.
tags: dahomey witch hazel hemorrhoid removal technique

title: Fact #231
text: Wesley Snipes once shot and poisoned director Guy Ritchie with a Somali blowpipe.

title: Fact #232
text: Wesley Snipes’ eleventh wife, Totti Leguizamo, fraternal twin of actor John, divorced Snipes while he was in prison on the grounds that the noises Snipes made licking his fingers while eating corn chips had derailed her acting career.

title: Fact #233
text: Wesley Snipes pronounced the word Guyana with a soft Brazilian “g.”

title: Fact #234
text: Between May and December 1997, during a rigorous two-week shoot for Robert Altman’s visionary tubular hacking sci-fi dystopia, Rem,1 Wesley Snipes told reporters he was living in a shoebox mansion on Varnum Street in Washington, D.C. so he could stay in character. According to Wheezy Hendricks, a veteran D.C. bum, Snipes was nowhere near Varnum Street, but lived in a UPS container store on Lamont Street where his then-girlfriend Taiwana Little worked as an undercover air hostess.
notes: <sup>1</sup> Posits a near future where rollerblading energy runners glide through a hive-like network of tubes to deliver misinformation to their obese overlords

title: Fact #235
text: While in prison, Wesley Snipes starred in three episodes of the Nigerian soap opera Lumu on Broad Street, the Nigerian Cheers. Snipes character, Obinse, the Nigerian Norm, was written out of the series shortly after his first appearance with producers citing an obscure Nigerian law forbidding imprisoned actors from appearing in more than three consecutive TV episodes.

title: Fact #236
text: In the unaired pilot for the mid-‘90s sitcom, Dodee Leaves Frank, Wesley Snipes played a hard-working student guide (Troy Forrests) battling an unspecified sleeping sickness. The pilot was produced by Sammy Hagar and featured a twenty-second Hagar cameo in which Hagar seizes an ownerless chihuahua and shakes it.

title: Fact #237
text: Wesley Snipes’ 2010 prison start-up, Massage in a Bottle, was voted prison innovation of the year by the Black Entertainment Television. In 2011, the business — a massage service where midgets arrived at private residences inside translucent “body tubes” and then “uncorked” themselves to give full-body massages — suffered insurmountable setbacks1 despite heavy, last-minute donations from an unspecified coterie of Nigerian businessmen.
notes: <sup>1</sup>Nickie Tumer, brother-in-law of Snipes’ ninth wife, cane sugar cube mogul Eliza Sponza, was believed to have embezzled half of the original investment.

title: Fact #238
text: Unlike ninety percent of pituitary midgets, Wesley Snipes was not a midget from birth.

title: Fact #239
text: In a paid eulogy delivered to the answering machine of Harvey Weinstein, who he had confused for Gerry Heinberg, Snipes’ one-time publicist, Ving Rhames reputedly said that Snipes was a “hard-working midget.” For twenty years following his appearance in Pulp Fiction and his cameo as Dr. Bulgo in The Sweeper, Rhames earned union wages writing and delivering celebrity eulogies.

title: Fact #240
text: According to longtime friend Ronda Rousey, due to a boyhood motor-boating incident, Wesley Snipes was physically incapable of vomiting.

title: Fact #241
text: To play midget plastic explosives expert Ned Romain Jr., a.k.a “Little Ned,” in The Expendables 3, the Snipes Estate hired Barbara Hundis, a Snipes impersonator best known for her work at Snipes’ funeral as Snipes’ stand-in cadaver.

title: Fact #242
text: Playing Jewish provocateur Nelson Piles in Paul Greengrass’s 2009 remake of the 1969 academy award-winning The Rug, Wesley Snipes, out on two-week furlough, purportedly ate a bag of raw mixed hot peppers to prepare for his final scene with maniac Persian rug salesman Denny Cavendish (Barry Pepper).

title: Fact #243
text: To play dental tape mogul Delmore Schwartz in Give Me Mercy: The Delmore Schwartz Story, Wesley Snipes gained sixity-five pounds and taught himself Yiddish.

title: Fact #244
text: Wesley Snipes wasn’t the only midget to read for the voice of Blemish, a Colombian soft taco truck in Mel Schumacher’s Transformers 4: Rise of the Two-Wheel Drive Menaces. Comedian John Oliver and Peter Weller also claimed to have auditioned for the part, which ultimately went to Pepe Serna, a Hobson’s dwarf of Israeli-Austrian descent

title: Fact #245
text: Wesley Snipes was tapped for the role of Jefferson Kotto in Chico Ojiro’s High Chapparal: The Yaphet Kotto Story. At the last minute, however, Ojiro withdrew the offer when he found out that Snipes, a notorious tax evading midget, had died in prison.

title: Fact #246
text: Cannibal priestess/moon goddess Dr. Brittney Cooper dedicated her latest Kickstarter project Gaza: A Tribute to Harriet Tubman to Wesley Steenburgen Snipes, Snipes’ stepson from his fifth marriage to adopted daughter of Mary Steenburgen, Lena “Jerry Lee Lewis” Steenburgen.

title: Fact #247
text: Wesley Snipes’ great maternal uncle, Renaldo Escobar de Suiza, re-invented asphalt in Puerto Rico in 1957. Puerto Rican asphalt, nicknamed “de Suiza,” is used today in Sierra Leone, Madagascar, and the breakaway Republic of Lesser Kazakhstan. It was also the preferred driving surface of monotesticled Texan bicyclist Lance Armstrong.

title: Fact #248
text: A week before his death in the ill-fated Lewis Run Tax Evaders Prison Revolt, Wesley Snipes performed a Haitian voodoo rite with fellow entertaining midget Sean Penn to ward off future hurricanes in the Carribeans. The performance also starred Alex Trebek, Tonya Harding (on her comeback tour), Hubert Gerulaitus (brother of the late Vitus and a supporter of Penn’s philanthropic work in Haiti), and Jesse Orosco. The ceremony was broadcast throughout the prison on closed circuit TV.

title: Fact #249
text: Wesley Peabody Snipes was the youngest midget to have been inducted into the Little Performers wing of the Little Men’s Hall of Fame in Marin County, California.

title: Fact #250
text: It was Wesley Snipes, playing a nameless German sniper, who shot Mark Lee in Peter Weir’s 1981 Dune spinoff Gallipoli. Snipes would later remark that upon realizing he was a midget, Weir jokingly suggested that he should get paid in proportion to his body size. In retribution, Snipes shouted in Pig Latin1 at the critical moment when Lee is shot for a record 200 takes, at which point Weir fired Snipes and brought in Austrian figure skating champion Klaus Kinski.
notes: <sup>1</sup>Snipes is a respected Pig Latinist.

title: Fact #251
text: Wesley Snipes was known to refuse noodles as many as three times a night.

title: Fact #252
text: Wesley Snipes never had a zip code.

title: Fact #253
text: Wesley Snipes’ final request before his death was to hear midget friend and fellow Pig Latinist Sean Penn re-record Harry Belafonte’s classic Banana Boat Song with the Chipmunks.

title: Fact #254
text: Wesley Snipes was the nephew of film critic Roger Ebert.

title: Fact #255
text: For the final scene of Trigger Happy, in which all the other characters drink paint thinner before shooting each other in the shins at the bidding of Barba Grossa (Al Pacino), Wesley Snipes was the lone voice of dissent, demanding that his refreshment be clearly labeled “Liquid Kickass.” Referencing the scene on Inside the Actors Studio with one-time French pimp James Lipton, Pacino remembered Snipes as a “classy but repugnant little man.”

title: Fact #256
text: As a child Snipes never learned how to play marbles.

title: Fact #257
text: The part of Moses Hightower (Bubba Smith) in Police Academy was originally written for a young Wesley Snipes.

title: Fact #258
text: Brian Dennehey and Wesley Snipes collaborated on a children’s book called The Awesome Adventures of Chuck E. Cheese. The book was co-written with dwarf vegetarian Jonathan Safran Foer.

title: Fact #259
text: The Awesome Adventures of Chuck E. Cheese, inspired by a series of finger paintings Brian Dennehy made as a chicken while under deep hypnosis, was the first children’s book to see a working collaboration between an African American midget (Wesley Snipes) and a Caucasian dwarf (Jonathan Safran Foer).

title: Fact #260
text: In at least five Parisian district courts Jonathan Safran Foer is considered the only living heir to the Wesley Snipes Estate.
