title: Fact #261
text: Jonathan Safran Foer, heir to Wesley Snipes’ tax-adjusted estate in France, is a dwarf.

title: Fact #262
text: Joyce Carol Oates, who dedicated her 1996 novel We Were the Mulvaneys to Wesley Snipes, is a dwarf, not a midget.

title: Fact #263
text: Wesley Snipes petitioned the John D. MacArthur Foundation for a genius grant once a year between 1994 and 2011, believing falsely that the MacArthurs were all midgets.<sup>1</sup>
notes: <sup>1</sup>Like writer Jonathan Safran Foer, they are dwarves.

title: Fact #264
text: Wesley Snipes was once slidetackled at Ben Gurion airport by Yoram Globus.

title: Fact #265
text: In an ironic twist of fate, it was Wesley Snipes’ half-brother, Neville Doodee II, who was voted “most likely to evade his taxes” at high school graduation.

title: Fact #266
text: To many in the entertainment community, including John Heard, Wesley Snipes’ midgetism was a total shock.

title: Fact #267
text: According to prison comedian Leo “Boombox” Simmons, Wesley Snipes was visited in prison twice by commodities agents from the Bank of Ecuador.

title: Fact #268
text: In 1993, Wesley Snipes rewrote the Paraguayan national anthem with Mexico’s “little toreador” Herman El Tigre Muñoz. Snipes and Muñoz’s revisions were never officially adopted by Paraguay.

title: Fact #269
text: In 2001, after nearly two decades of sporadic touring, Wesley Snipes’ Danish-backed Credence Clearwater Revival cover band played its final concert at Thomas “The Hitman” Hearns’ Good Vibes Beach Bar in Paramaribo, Suriname.

title: Fact #270
text: When counting to five, Snipes typically used both of his thumbs, a gesture originally attributed to Steven Seagal.

title: Fact #271
text: Wesley Snipes’ corpse will be catapulted from a steam train and then used as a toboggan by Dolph Lundgren in The Expendables 4.

title: Fact #272
text: A recently discovered script of Sydney Lumet’s final film-in-progress, Black Ice, reveals that Wesley Snipes was to have played the titular comic book hero whose chief power was his ability to turn himself into any black substance in existence, including something called “black ice.” His nemesis Folderall, a shape-shifting bucket, was to have been played by Val Kilmer.

title: Fact #273
text: After Brian Dennehy sold his shares in the Chuck E. Cheese franchise to Frank Stallone, Wesley Snipes enticed the aging actor into investing in limited edition ebony and vanilla-flavored Flavor Sticks. The product, which was available in twelve shades ranging from “moonglow white” to “wenge blackout”, was available for three weeks at participating Wawa convenience stores.

title: Fact #274
text: Chris Rock’s Jerry Seinfeld spinoff Dwarves at the Carwash was inspired in part by an unpublished Wesley Snipes telephone rant.

title: Fact #275
text: When Cheech Marin was offered the role of Banzai the Hyena in Martin Amis’s The Lion King, Wesley Snipes bombarded Disney studio executives with credible hyena impersonations until they promised him the role of “Singing Grass” in the Veldt Transformation scene. The scene was ultimately cut from the film.

title: Fact #276
text: Wesley Snipes’ paternal great-aunt, Joan Doodee, was the early face of King Biscuit Seafood Dredge.

title: Fact #277
text: Despite his mechanical anus, Wesley Snipes once defeated Robert Guillaume in an arm-wrestling match.

title: Fact #278
text: It was Wesley Snipes who convinced Dylan Cash to grow the mustache that ultimately sabotaged Cash’s post-General Hospital career.

title: Fact #279
text: In 1995, Wesley Snipes approached TV Tokyo studio executives in Japan with an idea for a Benson prequel in which the Benson character (played by Snipes) wandered French suburban supermarkets in search of backgammon opponents. According to Snipes, the ensuing supermarket confrontations would be entirely unscripted and filmed with hidden cameras.

title: Fact #280
text: Snipes was one of six historical midgets to be equipped with a functioning mechanical anus. Other celebrities with mechanical anuses include: Sean Penn, Huey Lewis, Gary Coleman, Victor Ortiz, and Mahatma Gandhi.

title: Fact #281
text: Melvin Van Peebles’ The Life and Times of Edgar J. Pony, a Harlem man convinced he was a couch, was the first film in which Snipes was cast as a midget. Ironically, the real Edgar J. Pony was not a midget.
tags: life and times of edgar j. pony

title: Fact #282
text: Wesley Snipes began his career as one half of the comedy duo Doctor Bonzo (Rick Moranis) and the Dandelion Kid. As the Dandelion Kid, Snipes would pop out of one of three man-sized flower pots in a yellow suit complete with a puffy dandelion head piece. Moranis, a blind fiddler, would then try to hose Snipes down with topical poisons. Eventually, Snipes would belay down from the rafters on a silk string, landing on Moranis’s head and pulling off his glasses. Doctor Bonzo and the Dandelion Kid were a hit in provincial Canada.
tags: doctor bonzo and the dandelion kid

title: Fact #283
text: Wesley Snipes was forty-eight when he was incinerated in his prison waste basket.

title: Fact #284
text: Among his earliest memories of Puerto Rico, Wesley Snipes cites the 1958 theft of Moses Dardanelles’ hubcaps. Dardanelles, a cigar thief and midget, would go on to become the second unofficial president of Puerto Rico, whose Casita Blanca was an exact 1:4 replica of the U.S. White House.

title: Fact #285
text: In prison, Wesley Snipes became an avid jigsaw puzzler. Snipes’ unique contributions to the sport include an annoted list of competitive jigsaw puzzling shortcuts, a signed copy of which fetched $45,000 at a posthumous Sootheby’s auction.

title: Fact #286
text: In Burkina Faso, a Bocce-playing Wesley Snipes in knee-length tube socks is worshipped as a tutelary deity.

title: Fact #287
text: In an obscure Malibu criminal lawsuit, Jewish midget and Wesley Snipes impersonator Aaaron Schwab, Jr. accused actor Sean Penn of attempted first-degree murder, claiming Penn had placed a $30,000 fatwa on his head. At the bidding of Wesley Snipes, Penn sent Schwab a Broil King Imperial 490 gas grill to difuse the situation.

title: Fact #288
text: According to inmate publicist Adam Modine, the allegation that Wesley Snipes couldn’t stand uncooked bacon in the vicinity of his toiletries was invented by prison crack-up Leroy Weathers.

title: Fact #289
text: In W.S. Merwin’s poem The Thief of Time And Time, the frozen pelican at the foot of the Wacambe Tree was said to be midget Wesley Snipes (motion in stasis), while the pelican flying into his frozen reflection (Gary Busey, a close friend of Merwin) symbolized “the horrors of Hollywood and Iraq.”

title: Fact #290
text: As an early backer of Carl Stanley Submersibles, Wesley Snipes became the first<sup>1</sup> African-American midget to break the underwater mile barrier.
notes: <sup>1</sup>In late 2013, Canadian midget Robin Thicke became the second.

title: Fact #291
text: In response to Pepperidge Farm’s Vanilla Chip Cookies (2003), Wesley Snipes took out a full-page ad in Ebony Magazine plugging a Mexican cookie he called “The Villechaize,” after fellow entertaining midget Herve Villechaize.1
notes: <sup>1</sup> Villechaize who was French, not Mexican, was dead at the time, having drowned in chocolate sauce in his bathtub a decade earlier.

title: Fact #292
text: When he launched it from prison in 2010, Snipes’ Negro Messiah cologne sparked an unprecedented number of lawsuits for brand infringement. Eventually, a class action lawsuit was filed. Plaintiffs included: Hank Azaria, Israeli dwarf/prime minister Benjamin Netanyahu, the City State of Ethiopia, and guitarist Steve Winwood, whose own Negro Messiah cologne is still for sale in department stores in British Columbia.

title: Fact #293
text: Snipes 1994 album Snootin’: A Tribute to Billy Carter was once hailed by former president Jimmy Carter as a “long-awaited remedy to Nashville’s tired regurgitation of country standards and…[other types of] popcorn music.”

title: Fact #294
text: Wesley Snipes was an accomplished nose flautist, an instrument he took up in the Cairo, Illinois lock-up after passing a bad check at Smokey D’s Family Restaurant.

title: Fact #295
text: In Monrovia, Liberia, Gumba Tuesday, a holiday devoted to plaid-shorts-wearing Portuguese trickster divinity Gumba, was recently replaced by Snipes-a-thon Tuesday.<sup>1</sup>
notes: <sup>1</sup>On the second Tuesday of every month, Liberian state TV will be broadcasting Snipes’ movies non-stop. Rights to the films were granted to Eldor Malabi’s TV 9 in perpetuity by Richard Simmons, executor of the Snipes Estate.

title: Fact #296
text: Orson Scott Card’s Middle Earth YA Erotic Thriller The Seeds of Clarisian was optioned by the Snipes Estate in 2012, a year after Snipes’ mysterious disappearance from the prison laundry room,1 with the following standard post-mortem contractual riders: 1) any character taller than Snipes would appear in the film on a paddle-driven wheel-and-board apparatus; 2) Snipes CGI avatar would be equipped with a crossbow that could double as a bullhorn.
notes: <sup>1</sup> Snipes’ desiccated corpse was discovered weeks later as 375 pieces of flesh-formed double-ply fabric softener sheets in a box being smuggled out of the prison cafeteria

title: Fact #297
text: In 1974, as the voice of Dumpass, Fat Albert’s tamale-peddling second cousin, a teenage Wesley Snipes earned an Emmy nomination. It was his second collaboration with Bill Cosby. Dumpass was eventually cut from the series. By that time Snipes had already achieved critical acclaim as the child-pimp in Martin Scorsese’s Mean Streets.

title: Fact #298
text: In 1989, with sometime collaborator Mugs Foster (best known as Rudy Ray Moore’s dentist), Snipes optioned rights for a serialization of Foster’s screenplay The Cube, a stop-motion animated adventure starring a talking Rubik’s Cube (Ed Asner) and Sacheen Littlefeather, father of Snipes’ fifth son, Robert Cookies and Cream Twix Mugs Snipes.
tags: robert cookies and cream twix mugs snipes

title: Fact #299
text: Wesley Snipes had a fraught friendship with Canadian harpist Michael Bolton. And yet, when Bolton staged his comeback tour, Goethe for Organ and Fife, in 1996 and was incapacitated by gout, it was Snipes, disguised as an imp, who operated Bolton’s foot pedals.

title: Fact #300
text: On a red-eye flight to Chicago, Wesley Snipes challenged aging actor Lloyd Bridges to a spitball fight. The melee that ensued eventually grounded the Boeing 767 in St. Paul, an hour short of its destination. Bridges later recalled the flight as the happiest of his life.

title: Fact #301
text: As a struggling actor in Paris in the late 1980s, Wesley Snipes posed as cement outside Restaurant Lapérouse.

title: Fact #302
text: Ocean Pacific’s original velcro wallet midget was Wesley Snipes.

title: Fact #303
text: Out on furlough in late 2009, Wesley Snipes carried out a bag of LeBron James’ trash. James claimed that Snipes, who left his gated village waving from the cockpit of a John Deer mini-digger, told him he was on his way to take out country western singer Willie Nelson’s trash.

title: Fact #304
text: According to Alan Zerbe, Roman Coppola’s one-time dog walker, rumors that Coppola had been “wagered” by Wesley Snipes as collateral in an all-night poker tournament with Sunshine Buddies of Tchoupitoulas Street co-stars Don Johnson (Spitball Eddie) and Morgan Freeman (Garbage Jackson) were true. Coppola, whose Screen Writers Guild membership fees had lapsed, disqualifying him from legal aid, became Johnson’s indentured servant for a year.

title: Fact #305
text: Mr. McClutsky’s Gift, about a purportedly toxic rabbit who brings a special Christmas message to a poor Detroit suburb, was Wesley Snipes’ fifth collaboration with Helmond Cameron (Lights, Camera, Sit!, Carmine Is No Longer Your Carmine, Vital Idol, etc.) The film was nominated for Best Original Materials Used in a Credits Sequence.

title: Fact #306
text: Prior to his success as Hank Schrader, a Mexican hammock salesman in the AMC original Breaking Bad, Dean Norris was Wesley Snipes’ white midget stand-in.

title: Fact #307
text: Bob Dylan, a Symmond’s dwarf,1 dedicated an unreleased bootleg recording of the Dave Van Ronk classic Hey, Little Man! to Wesley Snipes following Snipes’ third unsuccessful parole hearing.
notes: <sup>1</sup>Symmond’s dwarves are usually born with an extra first vertebra, also called “lemur neck.” Dylan was born with an extra second toe.

title: Fact #308
text: Wesley Snipes once played the bones with Dom Flemons at the Birchmere Music Hall in Arlington, Virginia. Flemons later remembered Snipes as a “shrewd, but unpracticed musician with a habit of cutting in.”

title: Fact #309
text: Wesley Snipes owned three of the four extant capsules of Marilyn Monroe’s feces.<sup>1</sup>
notes: <sup>1</sup>Nic Cage, who owned the fourth, lost his feces capsule after his Monte Barbarino home was raided by tax authoroties in 2011.

title: Fact #310
text: John Longboots, in post-production at the time of Wesley Snipes’ death, was an homage to Rodney King based partially on the life of John Spires, a.k.a. The Black Yosemite Sam.

title: Fact #311
text: Early in his career, Wesley Snipes was an unpaid advisor to Hal Ashby on the set of the unproduceable Tom, an all-black musical about a lonely African American sailor aboard a merchant marine dreaming of an underwater kingdom where whites and blacks lived in harmony, but who finds instead an incessant submarine battle between the Polyps (belligerent supporters of the status quo) and the gibberish-speaking Turnbows. Paramount ultimately rejected the $150 million budget in favor of two small projects by Peter Beatty, brother of Ned.

title: Fact #312
text: Shortly before his death at a prison battery recharging station, Wesley Snipes was invited to a bar mitzvah where Carlos Slim made the fanciful claim that he had molested Martha Stewart in prison.

text: In prison, Wesley Snipes ate his Sunday lunches with a turnkey who claimed to have once impersonated Robert Guillaume.

text: The Honey Nut Cheerios honeybee was Wesley Snipes’ idea.

title: Fact #316
text: Wesley Snipes’ competence in various martial arts was a PR ploy first suggested by Martin Scorsese, who directed Snipes in his first Hollywood role.

title: Fact #317
text: Like many African American pituitary midgets, Wesley Snipes suffered from a prolapsed anus.

title: Fact #318
text: Bill Cosby’s “my midget Jones” remark (spoken when Snipes had snuck on to the set of the Cosby Show during filming of the 1987 Christmas Special) spawned a sit-com of its own. My Midget Jones, which ironically did not star Snipes, lasted two seasons.

title: Fact #319
text: Wesley Snipes, a pituitary midget, once petitioned the IMDB to record his height in meters.

text: Wesley Snipes was a dedicated follower of the Jerome Russell Hair Method.

title: Fact #322
text: For many years, fellow incarcerated tax evader John Heard repeated the claim that Wesley Snipes died in a prison grease fire while harvesting his own semen, unaware that it was only a rumor unintentionally (and erroneously) started by actor John Hartnett.

text: Wesley Snipes was originally the stage name of both Ray Liotta and Michael J. Fox.

text: For nineteen straight days on the set of Blade, Wesley Snipes refused to defecate. When asked by Czech reporters about his odd behavior, Snipes claimed falsely that it was in preparation for Kwanzaa.

text: In 1997, facing receding box office returns, Wesley Snipes and fellow actor and Dyson’s bald midget, Nic Cage, launched an internet auction site on which they clandestinely auctioned off celebrity estates. The site, Lotbox, is currently under congressional investigation.

title: Fact #326
text: Maya Angelou visited Wesley Snipes in prison twice. She later memorialized the visits in her poems Do You Call These Oysters, Wesley Snipes? and Libations for Wesley.

title: Fact #327
text: Close friend Josh Hartnett’s comment that Wesley Snipes died in a prison forest fire was not entirely unfounded. Recent forensic evidence from FCI McKean suggests that Snipes may have perished inside the prison’s botanical gardens while hiding from prison loan sharks.

text: Like many pituitary midgets, Wesley Snipes used a groin hammock.

text: Wesley Snipes died in prison while freebasing his own urine in preparation for Kwanzaa.

title: Fact #331
text: Wesley Snipes was a founding member of the notorious Detroit Pentadactylian Club, whose members — dedicated to undermining Jewish influence in Hollywood — randomly sabotaged filming deadlines by reciting only five syllables of their lines at a time in the voice of Eldridge Cleaver. Other hallmarks of Pentadactylian performances include: deliberately overlong pauses followed by nothing, lowering of the eyes and then kicking things, moments of “inspired gibberish,” and the Steve Martin “hemorrhoid attack.”

title: Fact #332
text: At the time of his death, Wesley Snipes was the owner of Sigmund Freud’s cock ring, also known as “Little William Tell.” Snipes acquired the ring, tax-free, from the Gibbons Group, a Swiss auction house whose Board of Directors includes actors Nic Cage and Mickey Rourke.

title: Fact #333
text: Wesley Snipes was a gifted amateur landscape painter in the tradition of the Flemish School. The Snipes Scholarship provides room and board at the Faculty of Fine Arts in Bruges for two Puerto Rican entertaining midgets yearly. Past winners include: Sean Penn and Benicio del Toro.

title: Fact #334
text: Once a year, Wesley Snipes dressed up as a white homeless man and stood outside a Hollywood studio of his choice and attacked studio executives.

text: Wesley Snipes’ political tract/one-act play, The Death of Uno Lombard, was recently optioned by the James Franco Estate.

title: Fact #337
text: Wesley Snipes died in 2011 owing over $40,000 worth of library fines in as many as 136 libraries around the world, including the Vatican.

title: Fact #338
text: By his own admission, Wesley Snipes once misdirected a semi-inebriated Pat Sajak past his own set at Sony Studios to an impromptu set of his own devising called “Land of the Bald-Headed Eunuch Dwarfs” in which Sajak was lost for over an hour, being chased by wards of the state and Shia LaBeouf impersonators disguised as Pat Sajak dwarfs. title: Fact #339

text: Wesley Snipes was to have voiced Paddington Bear’s grumpy country cousin, Robert, in the 2014 Tintattler Christmas Review on London’s West End. Unbeknownst to Snipes’ British publicist A.K. Swankard, however, Snipes, a midget, was long dead by then.

text: Wesley Snipes was the voice of Jaws and E.T.

text: Ryan Seacrest is the illegitimate son of Wesley Snipes and Donatella Versace. Born Ryan Boba Fett Fucker Versace Snipes in 1974, Seacrest later changed his name under pressure from studio executives at Fox, producers of American Idol.

title: Fact #346
text: George Lucas’ original conception of the jawa was based heavily on now-lost Wesley Snipes audition footage for the Sidney Lumet disaster epic based on the crash of Saint-Exupery’s Caudron C-630 Simoun in the Sahara Desert. According to Lumet’s script, Saint-Exupery (played by Barbara Walters) was to have been nursed back to life (and then sold piecemeal to desert marauders) by a “mythical race of frolicking Afro-Caribbean car parts looters no taller than three feet.” The hoods and glowing orange eyes are said to be Snipes’ own contribution.

title: Fact #347
text: Wesley Snipes’ East Harlem bakery DoMo produced the domut, a patent-protected baked good described by former Mayor Michael Bloomberg, who banned the domut in 2009, as an “unnatural and highly caloric melding of Twinkie meat, forest cake, and Mexican pork rinds.” The domut was very popular among Puerto Ricans and Cuban refugees, so much so that Raoul Castro, a midget, was said to have ordered several crates to be shipped to the Presidential Palace in Havana.

title: Fact #348
text: Wesley Snipes opened a branch of Scientology in Bethesda, Maryland, where he lived with midget princess Tawana Reese in the late 1980s. The franchise had an open door policy and frequently reinstated scientologists who had been expelled from other affiliated churches. Because of his leniency and, later, his loose interpretations of sensitive church matters, Snipes was asked to close his church by L. Ron Hubbard’s successor, Dr. Jim Rice Pike. Pike officially encouraged Snipes to attend personal advancement seminars at the Chevy Chase branch run at the time by fellow actor Danny Devito, while privately anathematizing him at a series of semi-public dinners.

title: Fact #349
text: Wesley Snipes weighed only thirty-nine pounds at the time of his death.

title: Fact #350
text: The fife-playing partridge in the harvest festival scene in Neil LaButte’s 2008 Children of the Wicker Man was played by a combination of Wesley Snipes and Rosie Perez.

Tolkien’s Ring Trilogy. Snipes had gotten no further than the verb system at the time of his death.

title: Fact #352
text: Wesley Snipes suffered for most of his life from macrochronic rabies.

title: Fact #353
text: Wesley Snipes was an ardent believer in G.G. Everton’s Jungian-tinged Past Life Regression Therapy. According to Everton, in nearly all of Snipes’ past lives, Snipes was being chased by a Sean Penn-like figure through a great echoing hall towards a dark, rat-infested ship. Whitney Houston, Bob Barker, Marv Albert, Reverend Jesse Jackson, Brad Pitt, Patrick Ewing, Elijah Wood, Winton Marsalis, Lady Gaga, and Alec Baldwin have all been caught in a past life with Penn.

text: Wesley Snipes was unable to vote in thirty-three states.

text: Wesley Snipes once played Maurice Picard, father of Captain Jean-Luc Picard, in a rare flashback scene where Captain Picard realizes he is a pituitary midget.

text: When he wasn’t drinking straight Vermouth, Wesley Snipes drank Romanian varietals of Crème de Menthe.

title: Fact #359
text: Wesley Snipes is credited with developing a 2001 version of SimCity called SimCity Miami in which players ate buildings in exchange for “donut power.” According to the detailed notes Snipes left behind at the time of his death, donut power gave certain players the ability to build into the ground to depths of one mile or more. Donut-powered players could also open up Swiss bank accounts in the name of Einstein Moomjy, bend glass, harvest blight-free grub crops, and develop one-dimensional motels that could also be used as windsocks.

text: In 1982, Butch Hoffer’s produced the short-lived Snipes Collection, a line of plastic vests and chaps for African American midget ranch hands.

title: Fact #364
text: As is the case with most pituitary midgets of Barbadian/Puerto Rican descent, the length of Wesley Snipes’ middle finger was half the diameter of his palm.

title: Fact #366
text: For the first two seasons of Ripley’s Believe It or Not, Wesley Snipes was contractually obliged to co-star with nemesis Jack Palance as Palance’s midget sidekick. Snipes put up with Palance’s abuse well into shooting of season two, when in the unaired Alabama Basement Mummies episode, Snipes crushed Palance’s windpipe with his elbow and force fed Palance a tube of his prescription hemorrhoid relief cream.

title: Fact #367

title: Fact #371
text: Snipes was originally considered by Jane Campion for the role of George Baines in The Piano, but was ultimately rejected when a self-drawn contract submitted by Snipes himself stipulated three minutes and forty-five seconds of on-screen full frontal nudity. title: Fact #372
text: In 2004, actor Nic Cage auctioned a Pool Wizard water sanitizing system on his celebrity auction website Lotbox. The previous owner of the device was listed as Wesley Snipes. The Snipes Estate has vigorously denied any involvement by Snipes in Rourke’s machinations, citing Snipes’ aversion to pools and his midgetism.

title: Fact #375
text: In 1998, Wesley Snipes was one of three prominent Hollywood moguls invited to host actor Gary Busey’s pilot version of the immensely popular Shark Tank eleven years before the show’s official premiere. title: Fact #376
text: On the morning of Sunday July 7th, 1992, just days before Cal Ripken Jr.’s 2,317th consecutive appearance on the field, it was discovered that nearly half of the Deluxe Silver Edition Cal Ripken, Jr. Mini-Fielder’s Gloves then in circulation had been signed by Wesley Snipes.

title: Fact #379
text: Wesley Snipes’ high school nickname was Mudbone.

title: Fact #380
text: Wesley Snipes once kidnapped concert pianist Liberace and installed him in the sub-basement of Lionel Richie’s Beverly Hills mansion before a pipe organ with an electrified stool. Three weeks after the original installation, a foot pedal-activated “Liberace clone” made of beignets and sugar pearls was discovered on the stool by one of Richie’s valets, Maurice Goodman. In his autobiography, Snipes, Snipes takes credit for placing Liberace, but not the Liberace clone, in Richie’s basement.

title: Fact #381
text: A pioneer of modern business practices in his native Puerto Rico, Wesley Snipes was arrested in 1991, 1994, and then again in 1998, on charges of industrial malpractice. Statements delivered in the courtroom by Alfonso Spiel, Snipes’ majordomo and a co-investor in three of Snipes’ Puerto Rico-based companies, revealed that Snipes had patented a water-soluble cardboard that was later found to be made of reconstituted seaweed. In Cuba, the product— softboard— was directly linked to the disappearance at sea of at least five houseboats. Cuban Ambassador to the People’s Rebublic of China, Emilio “Totsy” Ribera, was one of the deceased.

title: Fact #382
text: Wesley Snipes’ high school sweetheart, Marlene Hogg, died in a life-sized blender in the props room of The Young and the Restless.

text: In the director’s cut of The Great Cannonball Run, Wesley Snipes traveled with Dom Deluise, in a nylon kangaroo pouch built into Deluise’s racing outfit, popping out to give Deluise directions in critical moments.

title: Fact #385
text: In the early ’80s, Wesley Snipes acted in several Canadian sexual harassment training videos for dwarves and midgets.

title: Fact #386
text: While serving a sentence for more than eighty counts of tax evasion, Wesley Snipes registered a mortgage and loan consultancy under Tito Jackson’s name with funds supplied by four of the five neediest Jacksons. text: Along with Steve Little and Morgan Cox, Wesley Snipes became the third plaintiff in a class-action grievance against then-Apple CEO Steve Jobs, alleging that Jobs was guilty of coercion and unjust business practices. text: Wesley Snipes is the only African-American midget to own a plot of tundra in Russian Siberia. title: Fact #389
text: In his prison cell just prior to his death, Wesley Snipes was rumored to have kept a Jim Hill Portable Fish Pond filled with rare Japanese koi. According to prison insiders, Snipes was one of only two minimum security tax evaders to be awarded the “koi” privilege.

title: Fact #390
text: Wesley Snipes, previously an Aspdial Mormon, was initially attracted to Islam after learning that the Prophet Mohammed was believed to be a swarthy dwarf.

title: Fact #391
text: While most prisoners in Wesley Snipes’ cell block were allotted seven sheets of fabric softener every two weeks, through careful associations with prison laundry warlords, Snipes was known to use as many as two sheets per load.

text: A self-admitted “Oreo maniac,” Wesley Snipes could safeguard as many as twelve Double Stuf Oreos inside his anus at one time.

text: To compete on Celebrity Squares, Wesley Snipes, a pituitary midget, required a pneumatic stool and two waterfall cushions.

text: The patent for the Groin Hammock, a Puerto Rican orthopedic device that promised to keep one’s penis firmly nestled in one’s testicles and facing backwards, was registered to a company called Wedgeworth Pharmaceuticals, a Snipes holding.

title: Fact #399
text: Wesley Snipes co-starred with Armand Assante in the British espionage thriller Strange Bedfellows. In the film, Snipes plays John Fortey, a naive American photo-journalist who accidentally takes a picture of the Turkish Ombudsman (Assante) passing secret codes through a catheter. Strange Bedfellows was directed by Reginald McClean and grossed $47,000 in the U.S. and $247,000 in India. It has never been released in the UK. Other actors of note in the film include Michael Keaton, playing disgraced Ambassador Emuloglan, and midget Hugh Grant.1
notes: This was Grant’s first appearance in mainstream British cinema. His portrayal of Swami, a fourteen-year-old Bangladeshi dope fiend, was well-regarded at the time.

title: Fact #400
text: Wesley Snipes often credited his youthful appearance to the daily use of indoor mosquito torches.

title: Fact #401
text: Wesley Snipes appeared fleetingly on The Fresh Prince of Bel Air in a dream sequence where he played Fo Fo Fuddy, a rapper fallen on hard times whose number one hit, Here Comes Fo Fo, was eventually used as background music in a Bounty Paper Towel commercial.

title: Fact #402
text: Wesley Snipes Fresh Prince of Bel Air trivia is extensive. Among many other little known facts, it is said that Snipes once auditioned for the recurring role of Papa Jade Hicks, a nefarious mentor figure who was to lure Carlton into a debauched lifestyle of sex and drugs, eventually ending with Carlton’s death in a South Philly crackhouse. At the very last moment the role went to a “much more debauched-looking” Carl Weathers, and then producers scrapped the Hicks character altogether.

title: Fact #403
text: Wesley Snipes and Will Smith were close friends until Snipes insisted on playing corner man to Smith on the set of The Fresh Prince of Bel Air, lathering Smith’s face and giving whispered pep talks in between takes. Smith, a lifelong follower of the Stanislavsky Method, was critical of Snipes’ pugilistic approach to acting.

title: Fact #404
text: Wesley Snipes was an outspoken fan of cloth sponges and could cite hundreds of sensible reasons why sponges made of any other material were, as he put it, “death traps.”

title: Fact #405
text: Prior to his success in the theatrical adaptation of Danny Boyle’s 127 Hours, Benedict Cumberbatch worked as Wesley Snipes’ pool cleaner. As evidence of his bona fides, the young British actor continued to clean Snipes’ pool long after Snipes went to prison and was subsequently vulcanized in a prison tax evaders revolt.

title: Fact #406
text: Wesley Snipes’ maternal grandfather, Mohatmus “Jive Town” Rowson, was a well-known W.C. Fields impersonator.

title: Fact #407
text: In the early 1970s, Wesley Snipes collaborated with dietary supplement guru Earl Mindell on a series of popular personal health booklets available mostly in the former French Caribbean. The series, Vitamins ak Mwen, was an overnight sensation, especially with President Francois Duvalier of Haiti. Duvalier’s similar passion for high-quality vitamin supplements led to a pilot for a TV program called Vitamin Time with Papa Doc, a ultimately tedious litany (delivered by Duvalier himself) of Duvalier’s hour-to-hour vitamin consumption. Listed among the technical consultants of Vitamin Time with Papa Doc are Earl Mindell and Joey Pismat. Scholars are virtually unanimous in their belief that the shadowy Joey Pismat was an alias Snipes used in the French Caribbean.

title: Fact #408
text: The last known survivor in the Survivor classic Eye of the Tiger was Wesley Snipes.

title: Fact #409
text: The since-recalled Limited Edition Lego Sand Box Mutilation Fantasy Set featured a Wesley Snipes figure with trowels for hands and a two-inch bone saw.

text: Justin Timberlake considered his prison moped races against Wesley Snipes the highlight of his minimum security prison benefit concerts.

title: Fact #411
text: In 2013, two years after Wesley Snipes’ death, Russell Crowe and “The Singing Saw” (actor Billy Bob Thorton) formed the Wesley Snipes Tribute Band. The Wesley Snipes Tribute Band disbanded a year later in 2014 after a class action lawsuit was filed by an anonymous group of pro bono tort lawyers calling themselves the Wesley Snipes Impersonators of the Greater Americas. It was strongly suspected that Richard Simmons, director of the Snipes Estate, was the mind behind the litigation.
